column4: 身高偏离该年龄性别预期身高的正常范围。

column4: 多囊性肾发育不良的特点是：肾脏有大小不一的肾囊肿，缺乏正常肾盂肾盏系统。这种状态伴发输尿管或肾盂输尿管闭锁，受累肾脏无功能。
column5: Multicystic dysplasia of the kidney is characterized by multiple cysts of varying size in the kidney and the absence of a normal pelvocaliceal system. The condition is associated with ureteral or ureteropelvic atresia, and the affected kidney is nonfunctional.
The pattern in which a particular genetic trait or disorder is passed from one generation to the next.

A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on one of the autosomes (i.e., the human chromosomes 1-22) in which a trait manifests in heterozygotes. In the context of medical genetics, an autosomal dominant disorder is caused when a single copy of the mutant allele is present. Males and females are affected equally, and can both transmit the disorder with a risk of 50% for each child of inheriting the mutant allele.

A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on one of the autosomes (i.e., the human chromosomes 1-22) in which a trait manifests in homozygotes. In the context of medical genetics, autosomal recessive disorders manifest in homozygotes (with two copies of the mutant allele) or compound heterozygotes (whereby each copy of a gene has a distinct mutant allele).

column5: Hermaphroditism refers to a discrepancy between the morphology of the gonads and that of the external genitalia. In male pseudohermaphroditism, the genotype is male (XY) and the external genitalia are imcompletely virilized, ambiguous, or complete female. If gonads are present, they are testes.

column4: 根据生殖器外型无法确定是属于哪一种性别。外阴性别不明可以使用Prader计分来进行评估：Prader 0:正常女性外生殖器；Prader 1:女性外阴但阴蒂增大；Prader 2:阴蒂较大，阴唇部分融合，形成漏斗状阴道口；Prader 3:阴茎增大，阴唇完全融合形成尿生殖窦，有单一的尿道开口。Prader 4:阴囊完全融合，泌尿生殖口在阴茎的根部或阴茎上，类似尿道下裂；Prader 5:正常男性外生殖器。Prader 1-4 诊断为外阴性别不明。
column5: A genital phenotype that is not clearly assignable to a single gender. Ambiguous genitalia can be evaluated using the Prader scale: Prader 0: Normal female external genitalia. Prader 1: Female external genitalia with clitoromegaly. Prader 2: Clitoromegaly with partial labial fusion forming a funnel-shaped urogenital sinus. Prader 3: Increased phallic enlargement. Complete labioscrotal fusion forming a urogenital sinus with a single opening. Prader 4: Complete scrotal fusion with urogenital opening at the base or on the shaft of the phallus. Prader 5: Normal male external genitalia. The diagnosis of ambiguous genitalia is made for Prader 1-4.

column4: 唇部的异常。
column5: An abnormality of the `lip` (FMA:59815).

column4: 嘴巴的连合间距离低于平均值超过2个标准偏差。或者嘴巴开口的距离显得减小（主观）。
column5: Distance between the commissures of the `mouth` (FMA:49184) more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased width of the oral aperture (subjective).

column4: 一种表现为有上唇中线（中）沟痕的唇裂。
column5: A type of `cleft lip` (HP:0000204) presenting as a midline (median) gap in the upper lip.

column4: 舌头向后位移到咽部，即舌头向后错位。
column5: Posterior displacement of the tongue into the pharynx, i.e., a `tongue` (FMA:54640) that is `mislocalised posteriorly` (PATO:0001922).

column4: 口腔的异常，即开口或嘴中空的部分。
column5: Abnormality of the `oral cavity` (FMA:20292), i.e., the opening or hollow part of the mouth.

column4: 牙齿的任何异常。
column5: Any abnormality of the `teeth` (FMA:12516).

column4: 程度严重的牙周炎。
column5: A `severe` (PATO:0000396) form of `periodontitis` (HP:0000165).

column4: 牙龈的任何异常。
column5: Any abnormality of the `gingiva` (FMA:59762) (also known as gums).

column4: 牙龈部位发生的纤维瘤。
column5: The presence of `fibrosis` (MPATH:181) of the `gingiva` (FMA:59762).

column4: 舌的长度和宽度减小的。
column5: Decreased length and width of the `tongue` (FMA:54640).

column4: 悬雍垂的异常。悬雍垂是从软腭后缘正中悬垂的小圆锥体。
column5: Abnormality of the `uvula` (FMA:55022), the conic projection from the posterior edge of the middle of the soft palate.

column4: 腭（即口内顶部）的任何异常。
column5: Any abnormality of the `palate` (FMA:54549), i.e., of roof of the mouth).

column4: 腭裂是由腭突融合失败造成的发育缺陷，表现为口腔顶（软硬腭）的分裂。
column5: Cleft palate is a developmental defect of the `palate` (FMA:54549) resulting from a failure of fusion of the palatine processes and manifesting as a separation of the roof of the mouth (soft and hard palate).

column4: 粘膜下硬腭裂以形成口腔顶部的骨性硬腭中间部缺损为特征。可能在触诊硬腭时检查出来。
column5: Hard-palate submucous clefts are characterized by bony defects in the midline of the bony palate that are covered by the mucous membrane of the roof of the mouth. It may be possible to detect a submucous cleft hard palate upon palpation as a notch in the bony palate.

column4: 上唇的异常。
column5: An abnormality of the `upper lip` (FMA:59817).

column4: 下唇的异常。
column5: An abnormality of the `lower lip` (FMA:59818).

column4: 下唇厚度增加，导致下唇外观突出。下唇中线唇红的高度大于平均值超过2个标准偏差。或者，从正面看下唇唇红的高度显得增加（主观）。
column5: Increased thickness of the lower lip, leading to a prominent appearance of the lower lip. The height of the vermilion of the lower lip in the midline is more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased height of the vermilion of the lower lip in the frontal view (subjective).

column4: 舌头边缘和/或表面上产生的多个凹陷和/或凸起，形成不规则的表面轮廓。
column5: Multiple indentations and/or elevations on the edge and/or surface of the tongue producing an irregular surface contour.

column4: 软腭（也称为软腭，或肌肉腭）的裂口，为第7周和第12周妊娠之间发生的发育缺陷的结果。软腭裂可导致咽鼓管功能异常，由此导致中耳畸形和听力困难，以及因腭咽闭合不全带来的伴有重鼻音的语言问题。
column5: Cleft of the soft palate (also known as the velum, or muscular palate) as a result of a developmental defect occurring between the 7th and 12th week of pregnancy. Cleft soft palate can cause functional abnormalities of the Eustachian tube with resulting middle ear anomalies and hearing difficulties, as well as speech problems associated with hypernasal speech due to velopharyngeal insufficiency.

column4: 上唇的宽度减小。
column5: `Decreased width` (PATO:0000599) of the `upper lip` (FMA:59817).

column4: 上腭宽度低于平均值超过2个标准偏差（客观）或腭宽度显得减小（主观）。
column5: Width of the palate more than 2 SD below the mean (objective) or apparently decreased palatal width (subjective).

column4: 舌系带的异常或口腔内存在多余的系带。舌系带指连接舌头和口腔底部粘膜的小褶皱。
column5: An abnormality of the `lingual frenulum` (FMA:59820), that is of the small fold of mucous membrane that attaches the tongue to the floor of the mouth, or the presence of accessory frenula in the oral cavity.

column4: 从牙槽嵴延伸到上或下唇内表面上的额外折叠组织。
column5: Extra fold of tissue extending from the alveolar ridge to the inner surface of the upper or lower lip.

column4: 悬雍垂分裂成两部分，最容易在尖端看到。
column5: `Uvula` (FMA:55022) separated into two parts most easily seen at the tip.

column4: 下唇的唇红处存在凹陷，通常接近正中部位。
column5: Depression located on the `vermilion of the lower lip` (FMA:59828), usually paramedian.

column4: 腮腺的任何异常。腮腺是位于面部覆盖下颌支皮下组织的唾液腺，在外耳的前下方。
column5: Any abnormality of the parotid glands, which are the salivary glands that are located in the subcutaneous tissues of the face overlying the mandibular ramus and anterior and inferior to the external ear.

column4: 舌头表面或内部结节。
column5: Nodules on/in the tongue.

column4: 异常短小的舌系带
column5: The presence of an abnormally short `lingual frenulum` (FMA:59820).

column4: 皮埃尔-罗宾畸形的特点是小下颌（下颌发育不全），舌下垂和腭裂的发育畸形序列。
column5: Pierre Robin malformation is a sequence of developmental malformations characterized by `micrognathia (mandibular hypoplasia)` (HP:0000347), `glossoptosis` (HP:0000162) and `cleft palate` (HP:0000175).

column4: 口腔中有裂口，有唇裂和腭裂两种主要类型。唇裂指上颌和正中鼻突的先天性融合失败而形成在唇部的凹槽或裂缝。腭裂指腭先天性未能正确融合而在口腔顶部形成带槽凹陷或裂缝。唇颚裂可单独或合并发生。最好是每个缺陷分别编码。
column5: The presence of a cleft in the oral cavity, the two main types of which are cleft lip and cleft palate. In cleft lip, there is the congenital failure of the maxillary and median nasal processes to fuse, forming a groove or fissure in the lip. In cleft palate, there is a congenital failure of the palate to fuse properly, forming a grooved depression or fissure in the roof of the mouth. Clefts of the lip and palate can occur individually or together. It is preferable to code each defect separately.

column4: 上唇的间隙。这是胚胎发育过程中唇组织非融合造成的先天性缺陷。
column5: A gap in the `upper lip` (FMA:59817). This is a congenital defect resulting from nonfusion of tissues of the lip during embryonal development.

column4: 由于嘴唇收缩导致唇周皮肤呈放射状的一种面部畸形。
column5: An abnormality of the appearance of the face caused by constant contraction of the lips leading to a puckered or pursed appearance.

column4: 舌头发炎。
column5: Inflammation of the tongue.

column4: 嘴呈三角形。
column5: The presence of a `triangular` (PATO:0001875) form of the `mouth` (FMA:49184).

column4: 张口能力受限。
column5: Limitation in the ability to open the mouth.

column4: 牙龈增生即覆盖在牙槽嵴上的软组织变厚。增厚范围从仅包括齿间乳头，到牙龈增生覆盖整个牙冠。
column5: `Hyperplasia` (MPATH:134) of the `gingiva` (FMA:59762, that is, a thickening of the soft tissue overlying the alveolar ridge. The degree of thickening ranges from involvement of the interdental papillae alone to gingival overgrowth covering the entire tooth crown.

column4: 唇部的毛细血管扩张（即浅表小血管扩张）。
column5: `Telangiectasia` (MPATH:476) (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the `lips` (FMA:59815).

column4: 上唇中线唇红的高度大于平均值超过2个标准偏差。或者，从正面看下唇唇红的高度显得增加（主观）。
column5: Height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the midline more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the frontal view (subjective).

column4: 因唾液腺功能障碍导致的口腔黏膜干燥。
column5: Dryness of the mouth due to salivary gland dysfunction.

column4: 腭高大于平均值超过2个标准偏差（客观）或腭高在第一恒大臼齿处的水平高度超过该牙齿的高度的两倍（主观）。
column5: Height of the palate more than 2 SD above the mean (objective) or palatal height at the level of the first permanent molar more than twice the height of the teeth (subjective).

column4: 上唇中线唇红的高度小于平均值超过2个标准偏差。或者，从正面看上唇唇红的高度显得变短（主观）。
column5: Height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the midline more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the frontal view (subjective).

column4: 腭咽括约肌功能下降，言语时不能把鼻腔与口腔分开。
column5: Inability of velopharyngeal sphincter to sufficiently separate the nasal cavity from the oral cavity during speech.

column4: 舌头背侧表面上的凹槽加深。
column5: Accentuation of the grooves on the dorsal surface of the tongue.

column4: 牙龈发生过度角化
column5: `Hyperkeratosis` (MPATH:154) of the `gingiva` (FMA:59762).

column4: 味觉异常是指在饮食时口舌感觉的味道（主观感觉）异于正常人，也可表现为进食无味、味觉减退或味觉完全丧失。
column5: The taste patients feeling (subjective feeling) is different from normal while eating.

column4: 味觉是指食物在人的口腔内对味觉器官化学感受系统的刺激并产生的一种感觉。不同地域的人对味觉的分类不一样。使老人味觉减退的因素有很多，因为食物的滋味不仅来自于舌头的基本味觉，而且与嗅觉、视觉、神经等的作用有着密切的关系。
column5: The taste we feeling while eating is closely related to olfaction, vision as well as taste. Decreased taste sensation can be caused by a variety of reasons.

column4: 累及牙龈的出血
column5: `Hemorrhage` (MPATH:119) affecting the `gingiva` (FMA:59762).

column4: 舌的毛细血管扩张（即舌体的浅表小血管扩张）。
column5: `Telangiectasia` (MPATH:476) (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the tongue.

column4: 口腔中的毛细血管扩张。
column5: Presence of teleangiectases in the oral cavity.

column4: 牙龈发炎。
column5: `Inflammation` (MPATH:212) of the `gingiva` (FMA:59762).

column4: 下唇异常外翻，即从正面可见下唇唇红的内部（通常与牙齿相对）。
column5: An abnormal configuration of the `lower lip` (FMA:59818) such that it is turned outward i.e., `everted` (PATO:0001597), with the Inner aspect of the lower lip vermilion (normally opposing the teeth) being visible in a frontal view.

column4: 上唇唇红区皮肤显得变窄。
column5: Reduced width of the "skin of vermilion border region of upper lip" (FMA:312645).

column4: 头部的异常。
column5: An abnormality of the `head` (FMA:7154).

column2: Abnormality of the fontanelles and cranial sutures
column4: 囟门（在出生两年内骨化的由厚膜覆盖的区域）和颅缝（颅骨之间由韧带和纤维性关节构成的结缔组织相连形成的缝隙）的任何异常
column5: Any abnormality of the fontanelles (the regions covered by a thick membrane that normally ossify in the first two years of life) or the cranial sutures (the fibrous joints in which the articulating bones or cartilages of the skull are connected by sutural ligaments ).

column4: 前囟的任何异常。前囟即颅囟，位于冠状缝和矢状缝的交点。
column5: An abnormality of the anterior fontanelle, i.e., the cranial fontanelle that is located at the intersection of the coronal and sagittal sutures.
Abnormally decreased size of  the `anterior fontanelle` (FMA:75439) with respect to age-dependent norms.

column4: 脑积水是从脑脊液产生到吸收至体循环通路异常导致的脑室系统主动扩张。
column5: Hydrocephalus is an active distension of the ventricular system of the brain resulting from inadequate passage of CSF from its point of production within the cerebral ventricles to its point of absorption into the systemic circulation.

column4: 在新生儿中，两块额骨、两块顶骨和一块枕骨由纤维缝合线连接，形成一个小的后囟和一个较大的菱形前囟。这些区域允许头颅通过产道，以后可增长。出生后囟门逐渐骨化，后囟通常在出生后八周闭合，前囟在出生后9〜16个月时闭合。如果囟门比年龄相符的正常值大，则被诊断为大囟门。
column5: In newborns, the two frontal bones, two parietal bones, and one occipital bone are joined by fibrous sutures, which form a small posterior fontanelle, and a larger, diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle. These regions allow for the skull to pass the birth canal and for later growth. The fontanelles gradually ossify, whereby the posterior fontanelle usually closes by eight weeks and the anterior fontanelle by the 9th to 16th month of age. Large fontanelles are diagnosed if the fontanelles are larger than age-dependent norms.

column4: 颅骨大小的任何异常。
column5: Any abnormality of the size of the skull.

column4: 顶骨隆起是指在顶骨区明显突出。
column5: Parietal bossing is a marked prominence in the parietal region.

column4: 头颅呈三角形或三角锥形，尖位于额部中线，底位于两侧枕骨连线。
column5: Wedge-shaped, or triangular head, with the apex of the triangle at the midline of the forehead and the base of the triangle at the occiput.

column4: 颅骨畸形，呈前后径缩短，垂直径和水平径延长，常合并枕骨区畸形。
column5: A skull deformity characterized by a shortening of the anterior-posterior and an elongation of the transverse and vertical skulldiameters,, frequently combined with malformations of the occipital region.

column4: 鼻旁鼻（颅）窦的异常。鼻窦是头骨和面部的骨头内部与鼻腔相通的充满空气的空间，包括上颌窦，额窦，筛窦，和蝶窦。
column5: Abnormality of the paranasal (cranial) sinuses, which are air-filled spaces that are located within the bones of the skull and face and communicate with the nasal cavity. They comprise the maxillary sinuses, the frontal sinuses, the ethmoid sinuses, and the sphenoid sinuses.

column4: 由于病毒、细菌、真菌感染，过敏或自身免疫反应等原因所造成的鼻窦的炎症。（FMA:59679）
column5: Inflammation of the `paranasal sinuses` (FMA:59679) owing to a viral, bacterial, or fungal infection, allergy, or an autoimmune reaction.

column4: 头骨形状的异常，其特征为前后直径减小。即头指数大于81％，或头部的前后尺寸（长度）相比宽度显得缩短。
column5: An `abnormality of skull shape` (HP:0002648) characterized by a `decreased anterior-posterior diameter` (PATO:0002042). That is, a cephalic index greater than 81%. Alternatively, an apparently shortened anteroposterior dimension (length) of the head compared to width.

column4: 颅盖骨骨骼密度的异常增加。
column5: An abnormal increase of density of the bones making up the calvaria.

column4: 枕额（头）围（OFC）比年龄匹配的正常标准少3个标准差以上(参见Ross JJ, Frias JL 1977,  PMID:9683597)。或者头盖骨尺寸减小。
column5: Occipito-frontal (head) circumference (OFC) less than -3 standard deviations compared to appropriate, age matched, normal standards (Ross JJ, Frias JL 1977,  PMID:9683597). Alternatively, decreased size of the `cranium` (FMA:46565).

column4: 头围逐渐落后于同年龄和同性别的正常值时，可诊断为渐进性小头畸形。
column5: Progressive microcephaly is diagnosed when the head circumference falls progressively behind age- and gender-dependent norms.

column4: 急性鼻窦炎
column5: An `acute` (PATO:0000389) form of `sinusitis` (HP:0000246).

column4: 枕额（头）周长大于年龄和性别相匹配的正常值的第97百分位数。或者头盖骨尺寸显得增大。
column5: Occipitofrontal (head) circumference greater than 97th centile compared to appropriate, age matched, sex-matched normal standards. Alternatively, a apparently increased size of the `cranium` (FMA:46565).

column4: 与相应年龄正常值相比，前囟扩大。
column5: Enlargement of the `anterior fontanelle` (FMA:75439) with respect to age-dependent norms.

column4: 头的高度与宽度和长度相比过大。
column5: Tall head relative to width and length.

column4: 尖头畸形（希腊oxus尖锐，kephalos头）是指头颅呈锥形或尖形。
column5: Oxycephaly (from Greek oxus, sharp, and kephalos, head) refers to a conical or pointed shape of the skull.

column4: 乳突的异常。乳突指从颞骨乳突部底面突出的圆锥形突出。
column5: An abnormality of the `mastoid process` (FMA:52872), which is the conical prominence projecting from the undersurface of the mastoid portion of the temporal bone.

column4: 乳突骨的细菌感染炎症。乳突骨坐落于耳后，帮助空气从中耳排出。
column5: A bacterial infection of the mastoid bone. The mastoid bone, which sits behind the ear, consists of air spaces that help drain the middle ear.
Asymmetry of the bones of the skull.

column4: 一种以前-后直径过长为特征的颅骨形状异常，即头骨从面前到脑后的尺寸过长。头颅指数低于76％。或者说，相对于头部宽度，头部前-后长度显得过长。常由矢状缝的过早关闭导致。
column5: An `abnormality of skull shape` (HP:0002648) characterized by a `increased anterior-posterior diameter` (PATO:0002043), i.e., an increased antero-posterior dimension of the skull. Cephalic index less than 76%. Alternatively, an apparently increased antero-posterior length of the head compared to width. Often due to premature closure of the sagittal suture.

column4: 枕骨（颅骨后部）的凸度增加
column5: Increased convexity of the `occiput` (FMA:49187) (posterior part of the skull).

column4: 婴儿在出生时通常有两个囟门，菱形前囟在冠状缝和矢状缝交界处，后囟在枕顶骨的交点。后囟通常出生后第8周闭合，前囟平均出生后18个月闭合。本术语适用于的囟门闭合延迟/超出正常年龄。
column5: Infants normally have two fontanels at birth, the diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle at the junction of the coronal and sagittal sutures, and the posterior fontanelle at the intersection of the occipital and parietal bones. The posterior fontanelle usually closes by the 8th week of life, and the anterior fontanel closes by the 18th month of life on average. This term applies if there is delay of closure of the fontanelles beyond the normal age.

column4: 脸部的异常
column5: An abnormality of the `face` (FMA:24728).

column4: 上颌骨颧（前）突发育落后，通过侧面观察和/或触诊来识别。
column5: Underdevelopment of the malar (frontal) process of the maxilla, appreciated in profile and/or by palpation.

column4: 面部既短又窄
column5: A face that is short (HP:0011219) and narrow (HP:0000275).

column4: 两颧间（脸上部）和下颌角间（脸下部）的宽度低于平均值超过2个标准偏差（客观）;或者脸的上部和下部的宽度显得减小（主观）。
column5: Bizygomatic (upper face) and bigonial (lower face) width are both more than 2 standard deviations below the mean (objective); or, an apparent reduction in the width of the upper and lower face (subjective).

column4: 面部高度（长度）比平均值高大于2个标准偏差（客观）；或者，面部高度（长度）显得增加（主观）。
column5: Facial height (length) is more than 2 standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, an apparent increase in the height (length) of the face (subjective).

column4: 下颌骨的任何异常
column5: Any abnormality of the `mandible` (FMA:52748), the bone of the lower jaw.

column4: 下颌骨后移所导致的一种畸形
column5: An abnormality in which the `mandible` (FMA:52748) is `mislocalised posteriorly` (PATO:0001922).

column4: 眉毛，鼻子，嘴唇，嘴，下巴的外观不精细鲜明，通常是因为圆润和厚重的面部特征或伴有或没有皮下和骨组织增厚的皮肤增厚。
column5: Absence of fine and sharp appearance of brows, nose, lips, mouth, and chin, usually because of rounded and heavy features or thickened skin with or without thickening of subcutaneous and bony tissues.

column4: 双颧间（脸上部）和下颌角间（脸下部）宽度的大于平均值2个标准偏差（客观）;或者脸宽度显得增加（主观）。
column5: Bizygomatic (upper face) and bigonial (lower face) width greater than 2 standard deviations above the mean (objective); or an apparent increase in the width of the face (subjective).

column4: 始于上眼睑中部之上，并向下弯覆盖至内眼角前面和侧面的皮肤褶皱。
column5: A fold of skin starting above the medial aspect of the upper eyelid and arching downward to cover, pass in front of and lateral to the medial canthus.

column4: 面部皮下脂肪组织的量增加。
column5: An increased amount of subcutaneous fat tissue in the face.

column4: 人中的异常。
column5: An abnormality of the `philtrum` (FMA:59819).

column4: 由正上方唇红边缘测得的人中脊之间的距离大于平均值2个标准偏差以上，或人中脊之间的距离显得增加。
column5: Distance between the philtral ridges, measured just above the vermilion border, more than 2 standard deviations above the mean, or alternatively, an apparently increased distance between the ridges of the philtrum.

column4: 前额的异常。

column5: An anomaly of the midface, which is a region and not an anatomical term. It extends, superiorly, from the inferior orbital margin to, inferiorly, the level of nasal base. It is formed by the maxilla (upper jaw) and zygoma. Traditionally, the nose and premaxilla are not included in the midface.

column4: 从前方看面部外形较通常圆。
column5: The facial appearance is more circular than usual as viewed from the front.

column4: 核心为软骨的耳组织退行性赘生物，位于耳廓的前部（耳朵的外部）。

column4: 不能感知气味。这是一个通用术语，描述不能闻到的任何气味，可以是嗅觉过程中任何一部分异常而引起的，这一过程包括把气味物质吸收到覆盖嗅觉上皮的鼻腔粘膜，扩散到纤毛，与嗅觉神经元的受体位点结合，产生神经电冲动，从而感知的气味。
column5: An inability to perceive odors. This is a general term describing inability to smell arising in any part of the process of smelling from absorption of odorants into the nasal mucous overlying the olfactory epithelium, diffusion to the cilia, binding to olfactory receptor sites, generation of action potentials in olfactory neurons, and perception of a smell.

column5: Diminished length of the `neck` (FMA:7155).

column4: 累及胃肠道血管的发育异常。

column4: 颈部顶-底长度的增加。
column5: Increased inferior-superior length of the neck.

column4: 颈部肌肉不自主收缩导致头部运动异常或位置异常。
column5: Involuntary contractions of the `neck musculature` (FMA:71290) resulting in an abnormal posture of or abnormal movements of the head.

column4: 胎儿颈后皮肤厚度增厚。通过胎儿头部横断位位于透明隔腔和丘脑水平，倾斜向后包括小脑处测量皱褶。测量取自胎儿中线处，枕骨中部外侧缘至皮肤最外侧。在18至24周大于或等于6mm，或16至18周大于或等于5毫米可认为测量值显著。
column5: A thickening of the skin thickness in the posterior aspect of the fetal neck. A nuchal fold measurement is obtained in a transverse section of the fetal head at the level of the cavum septum pellucidum and thalami, angled posteriorly to include the cerebellum. The measurement is taken from the outer edge of the occiput bone to the outer skin limit directly in the midline. A measurement 6 mm or more is considered significant between 18 and 24 weeks and a measurement of 5 mm or more is considered significant at 16 to 18 weeks (pmid:16100637).

column4: 颈部一侧到另一侧宽度增加。
column5: Increased side-to-side width of the neck.

column4: 颈部囊性淋巴病变。
column5: A cystic lymphatic lesion of the `neck` (FMA:7155).

column4: 眼部异常，包括眼球的位置、间距和眼内组织的异常（54448 FMA）。
column5: Any abnormality of the `eye` (FMA:54448), including location, spacing, and intraocular abnormalities.

column4: 视网膜上的异常（FMA:58301）。
column5: An abnormality of the `retina` (FMA:58301).

column4: 视网膜的裂隙或凹槽。
column5: A notch or cleft of the retina.
Any abnormality of the `cornea` (FMA:58238), which is the transparent tissue at the front of the eye that covers the iris, pupil, and anterior chamber.

column4: 角膜的先天性异常（FMA:58238），其中角膜和眼睛的眼前段都小于正常。角膜的水平直径甚至在成年期没有达到10毫米。
column5: A congenital abnormality of the `cornea` (FMA:58238) in which the cornea and the anterior segment of the eye are smaller than normal. The horizontal diameter of the cornea does not reach 10 mm even in adulthood.

column4: 散光为角膜的水平和垂直曲率不同导致的屈光不正。
column5: Astigmatism describes a refractive error  characterized by a difference in the horizontal and vertical  curvature of the cornea.

column4: 散光的一种形式，其中一条子午线是远视，而垂直的另一条线上没有屈光不正。
column5: A form of astigmatism in which one meridian is hyperopic while the one at a right angle to it has no refractive error.

column4: 角膜扩大，但清晰度和功能正常。 巨角膜的诊断标准为出生时角膜水平直径12毫米或更大，或两岁后角膜水平直径达13mm或以上。
column5: An enlargement of the `cornea` (FMA:58238) with normal clarity and function. Megalocornea is diagnosed with a horizontal corneal diameter of 12 mm or more at birth or 13 mm or more after two years of age.

column4: 斜视（也称为斜视）是指两只眼睛视物方向不平行。
column5: Strabismus (also known as squint) is a condition in which the eyes are not properly aligned with each other.

column4: 出生后即发生的斜视。
column5: Congenital strabismus

column4: 视网膜的任何非炎性疾病。保留此非特异性术语​​是因为它在文献中广泛使用，但新的注解应注明精确的视网膜异常类型。
column5: Any noninflammatory disease of the retina. This nonspecific term is retained here because of its wide use in the literature, but if possible new annotations should indicate the precise type of retinal abnormality.

column4: 眼睛陷入面部平面的深度超过正常状态。
column5: An `eye` (FMA:54448) that is more deeply recessed into the plane of the face than is typical.

column4: 角膜的炎症。
column5: Inflammation of the cornea.

column4: 眼睑的异常。
column5: An abnormality of the `eyelids` (FMA:75178).

column4: 黄斑中心凹的异常（FMA:58658），黄斑中心区位于黄斑中央，此部位视锥细胞浓度最高，主导位于中央、高分辨率的视觉。
column5: An abnormality of the `fovea centralis` (FMA:58658), the central area of the macula that mediates central, high resolution vision and contains the largest concentration of cone cells in the retina.

column4: 睑裂倾角低于均值的两个标准差以上。
column5: The palpebral fissure inclination is more than two standard deviations below the mean.

column4: 存在复发性角膜上皮糜烂。虽然大部分角膜上皮缺损很快愈合，某些患者可能出现反复的溃疡。
column5: The presence of recurrent corneal epithelial erosions. Although most corneal epithelial defects heal quickly, some may show recurrent ulcerations.

column4: 在自愿或非自愿的眼球运动及控制时出现的异常。
column5: An abnormality in voluntary or involuntary eye movements or their control.

column2: Globe retraction and deviation on abduction
column3: 外展时眼球回缩和偏斜
column4: 外展时眼球的回缩和偏斜。
column5: Globe retraction and deviation on abduction

column4: 眼睑的炎症。
column5: Inflammation of the eyelids.

column4: 睫毛的异常
column5: An abnormality of the `eyelashes` (FMA:53669).

column4: 青光眼是视网膜神经节细胞减少的典型视神经病变，常伴有眼内压升高。
column5: Glaucoma refers loss of retinal ganglion cells in a characteristic pattern of optic neuropathy usually associated with increased intraocular pressure.

column4: 在结膜上的异常（FMA:59011）。
column5: An abnormality of the `conjunctiva` (FMA:59011).

column4: 结膜的血管曲折和转折数量增加。
column5: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the conjunctival blood vessels.

column4: 视力的异常。
column5: Abnormality of eyesight (visual perception).

column4: 视觉障碍指由于疾病、外伤、先天或退行性因素导致的不同程度的视力丧失，视物能力严重受限，需要额外的辅助。传统方法如屈光矫正、药物、手术等无法恢复丧失的视力。
column5: Visual impairment (or vision impairment) is vision loss (of a person) to such a degree as to qualify as an additional support need through a significant limitation of visual capability resulting from either disease, trauma, or congenital or degenerative conditions that cannot be corrected by conventional means, such as refractive correction, medication, or surgery.

column4: 内眦距离大于平均值超过两个标准偏差（客观）；或两眼内眦之间的距离显得增加。
column5: Distance between the inner canthi more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, apparently increased distance between the inner canthi.

column4: 上睑缘比正常位置低3毫米或更多，覆盖虹膜的上部分（客观角度）;或者遮蔽一部分进入瞳孔的光线（主观角度）。
column5: The upper eyelid margin is positioned 3 mm or more lower than usual and covers the superior portion of the iris (objective); or, the upper lid margin obscures at least part of the pupil (subjective).

column4: 在结膜上发生的炎症（FMA:59011）。
column5: Inflammation of the  `conjunctiva` (FMA:59011).

column4: 遗传性视网膜萎缩和变性。
column5: Hereditary degeneration and atrophy of the retina.

column3: 垂直性核上性凝视麻痹
column4: 核上性凝视麻痹在垂直方向无法正常视物，是脑损伤的结果。眼球随意运动丧失，但是由于脑干仍然完好，所有的反射共轭眼球运动正常。
column5: A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a vertical direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.

column4: 通过视网膜电流图检测发现的视网膜中各种类型细胞的电反应异常。
column5: Any abnormality of the electrical responses of various cell types in the retina as measured by electroretinography.

column4: 速度异常缓慢的眼跳。
column5: An abnormally slow velocity of the saccadic eye movements.

column4: 在晶状体上的异常（FMA:58241）。
column5: An abnormality of the `lens` (FMA:58241).

column4: 白内障是指晶状体或晶状体囊膜的不透明或混浊。
column5: A cataract is an opacity or clouding that develops in the crystalline `lens` (FMA:58241) of the eye or in its `capsule` (FMA:58881).

column4: 出生后即发现的白内障`（HP:0000518）。
column5: A congenital `cataract` (HP:0000518).

column4: 眼球向前突起于面部平面的程度远大于正常状态。
column5: An eye that is protruding anterior to the plane of the face to a greater extent than is typical.

column4: 缺乏泪液分泌。
column5: Absence of tear secretion.
A cataract that affects the region of the lens directly beneath the `capsule of the lens` (FMA:58881).

column4: 球结膜的粘膜表面出现扩张的小血管（约0.5〜1.0毫米）。
column5: The presence of small (ca. 0.5-1.0 mm) dilated blood vessels near the surface of the mucous membranes of the conjunctiva.

column4: 在虹膜上（FMA:58235）的异常，虹膜是位于角膜和晶状体之间的色素肌肉组织，虹膜中间的开口称为瞳孔。
column5: An abnormality of the `iris` (FMA:58235), which is the pigmented muscular tissue between the cornea and the lens, that is perforated by an opening called the pupil.

column4: 先天性缺少虹膜（FMA:58235）。
column5: Congenital absence of the `iris` (FMA:58235).

column4: 中间的上睫毛长度超过10mm或睫毛的长度增加（主观上）。
column5: Mid upper eyelash length >10 mm or increased length of the eyelashes (subjective).

column4: 没有眼球。
column5: Absence of the globe or eyeball.

column4: 原有视力逐渐下降。
column5: A reduction of previously attained ability to see.

column4: 角膜上发生的结晶样沉积。
column5: crystals happens on Corneal

column4: 脉络膜和视网膜的异常。
column5: An abnormality of the choroid and retina.

column4: 眼底脉络膜和视网膜层的萎缩。
column5: Atrophy of the choroid and retinal layers of the fundus.

column4: 眉毛的异常
column5: An abnormality of the `eyebrow` (FMA:54237).

column4: 眉毛的密度降低或数量减少和/或眉毛的直径缩小。
column5: Decreased density/number and/or decreased diameter of eyebrow hairs.

column4: 始于下眼睑中部之下，并向上弯覆盖至内眼角前面和侧面的皮肤褶皱。
column5: A fold of skin starting at or just below the medial aspect of the lower lid and arching upward to cover, extend in front of and lateral to the medial canthus.
Apparent optic disc swelling in the absence of increased intracranial pressure.

column4: 正常情况下，光线经眼球聚焦在视网膜上产生一清晰的影像，这一过程出现异常为屈光异常。
column5: An abnormality in the process of focusing of light by the eye in order to produce a sharp image on the retina.

column4: 屈光的一种，其特征是可以看清远处的物体，而近处的物体出现模糊。
column5: An abnormality of refraction characterized by the ability to see objects in the distance clearly, while objects nearby appear blurry.

column4: 视网膜内层（神经视网膜）与色素上皮层分离。
column5: Separation of the inner layers of the retina (neural retina) from the pigment epithelium.

column4: 眼睛向鼻子方向转动的能力下降。
column5: Reduced ability to move the eye in the direction of the nose.

column4: 视盘灰黄色的颜色变浅（视神经乳头在视网膜的部位）。视盘通常呈粉红色，中央凹陷微黄色。
column5: A pale yellow discoloration of the optic disk (the area of the optic nerve head in the retina). The optic disc normally has a pinkish hue with a central yellowish depression.

column4: 眼外侧肌肉麻痹。
column5: Paralysis of the external ocular muscles.

column4: 屈光异常的一种，其特征是看近处物体清楚，而远处的物体模糊。
column5: An abnormality of refraction characterized by the ability to see objects nearby clearly, while objects in the distance appear blurry.

column4: 视网膜的病变。是一种非特异性术语，因为它在文献中广泛使用，所以​​保留。但注解中应标明精确的视网膜病变类型。
column5: A deterioration of the retina. This nonspecific term is retained here because of its wide use in the literature, but if possible new annotations should indicate the precise type of retinal abnormality.

column4: 视网膜变性中的一种。
column5: Tapetoretinal degeneration

column4: 视锥和视杆细胞均营养不良。
column5: Cone-rod dystrophy

column4: 眼球正常的协调运动需要双眼同时注视同一目标，出现偏差即为眼球共轭运动异常。
column5: Any deviation from the normal motor coordination of the eyes that allows for bilateral fixation on a single object.

column3: 视网膜电流图检测不到波形
column4: 对视网膜电流图检测的刺激缺乏反馈。
column5: Lack of any response to stimulation upon electroretinography.

column4: 区分或识别颜色的能力异常。
column5: An anomaly in the ability to discriminate between or recognize colors.

column4: 黄色和蓝色区分障碍，可能是由于蓝色感光色素功能障碍所致。
column5: Difficulty distinguishing between yellow and blue, possible related to dysfunction of the S photopigment.
An abnormality of the `uvea` (FMA:58103), the vascular layer of the eyeball.

column4: 部分或全部葡萄膜的炎症反应。
column5: Inflammation of one or all portions of the uveal tract.
An abnormal white reflection from the pupil rather than the usual black reflection.

column4: 视网膜营养不良。
column5: Retinal dystrophy

Buphthalmos refers to a congenital open-angle glaucoma of the eye. The term buphthalmos (from Greek 'bous' or ox and 'ophthalmos' or eye) is descriptive of an enlarged eyeglobe resulting from increased intraocular pressure. The eyeglobe is especially prone to distension in newborns and infants because its collagen filaments are not as rigid as in adults and may easily be stretched.

column4: 遗传性眼前节发育不良的先天性畸形，其特征为虹膜角膜畸形，青光眼，虹膜基质发育不良，角膜后胚胎环和角膜混浊。
column5: A congenital malformation of the anterior segment characterized by iridicorneal malformation, glaucoma, iris stroma hypoplasia, posterior embryotoxon, and corneal opacities.

column4: 角膜上出现的瘢痕
column5: Corneal scarring

column4: 睫毛的缺失。
column5: Lack of eyelashes.

column4: 角膜的圆锥形畸形。
column5: A cone-shaped deformity of the cornea.

column4: 泪液排泄系统的发育障碍，导致鼻泪管不通。
column5: A developmental disorder of the lacrimal drainage system that most often affects the lacrimal ostium and resulting in non-opening of the nasolacrimal duct. It usually results from a non-canalization of the nasolacrimal duct.

column4: 斜视的一种，单眼或双眼向内侧转向（“交叉”）。
column5: A form of strabismus with one or both eyes turned inward ('crossed').

column4: 视网膜、视网膜色素上皮和脉络膜的区域性缺损。
column5: Absence of a region of the retina, retinal pigment epithelium, and choroid.

column4: 单眼或双眼异常小的发育异常。
column5: A developmental anomaly characterized by abnormal smallness of one or both eyes.

column4: 一种异常的眼球运动（HP:0000496），其特征是快速眼球运动（扫视）障碍。
column5: An `abnormality of eye movement` (HP:0000496) characterized by impairment of fast (saccadic) eye movements.

column4: 扫视下冲，即扫视眼球运动的幅度小于锁定对象所需的幅度。
column5: Saccadic undershoot, i.e., a saccadic eye movement that has less than the magnitude that would be required to gain fixation of the object.

column4: 视觉敏锐度的下降（这意味着在生命中某个时间点视力比现在好，与视力受损或视力受损的亚型区分）。
column5: Loss of visual acuity (implying that vision was better at a certain timepoint in live - otherwise the term is impaired vision or a subclass of that).

column4: 发生于视网膜内的出血。
column5: `Hemorrhage` (MPATH:119) occurring within the `retina` (FMA:58301).

column4: 眉毛密度/数量增加或眉毛直径增加。
column5: Increased density/number and/or increased diameter of eyebrow hairs.

column4: 盲点是指一个区域视觉敏锐度受损，这一区域被正常或相对完好的视力范围包饶。
column5: Scotoma refers to an area or island of loss or impairment of visual acuity surrounded by a field of normal or relatively well-preserved vision.

column4: 盲点（视觉范围内视力消失的区域）位于中心点与生理盲点之间大致水平的椭圆形区域内。
column5: A scotoma (area of diminished vision within the visual field) located between the central point of fixation and the blind spot with a roughly horizontal oval shape.

column4: 斜视的一种，单眼或双眼向外偏移。
column5: A form of strabismus with one or both eyes deviated outward.

column4: 在鼻泪管的淤塞（FMA:61063）。
column5: Blockage of the ` lacrimal duct` (FMA:61063).

column4: 色素性视网膜病。
column5: Pigmentary retinopathy

column4: 上下眼睑之间的垂直距离固定减少，并伴有短睑裂。
column5: A fixed reduction in the vertical distance between the upper and lower eyelids with short palpebral fissures.

column4: 睑裂向上倾斜度大于同龄人平均值加两倍标准差（客观）；或睑裂向上的倾斜度明显增大。
column5: The palpebral fissure inclination to the up is more than two standard deviations above the mean for age (objective); or, the upper inclination of the palpebral fissure is greater than typical for age.

column4: 点状的角膜上皮糜烂。
column5: Punctate corneal epithelial erosions

column4: 角膜中央带状（HP:0000481）钙的沉积，导致视力下降，出现异物感和眼睛刺激。
column5: An `abnormality of the cornea` (HP:0000481) characterized by the deposition of calcium in a band across the central cornea, leading to decreased vision, foreign body sensation, and ocular irritation.

column4: 眼眶深度减少而表现为眼球相对突出。
column5: Reduced depth of the orbits associated with prominent-appearing ocular globes.

column4: `视神经`上的异常（FMA:50863）。
column5: Abnormality of the `optic nerve` (FMA:50863).

column4: 向下方延伸的视神经裂。
column5: A cleft of the optic nerve that extends inferiorly.

column4: 一个发育缺陷，特点是眼球的某些部分（FMA:54448`）或眼附属器的缺损。
column5: A developmental defect characterized by a cleft of some portion of the `eye` (FMA:54448`) or ocular adnexa.

column4: 最初的双眼上睑下垂，随后在各个方向上出现眼球运动限制和扫视变缓。
column5: Initial bilateral ptosis followed by limitation of eye movements in all directions and slowing of saccades.

column4: 巩膜上的异常（FMA:58269）。
column5: An abnormality of the `sclera` (FMA:58269).

column4: 巩膜上的异常蓝色着色（FMA:58269）。
column5: An abnormal bluish coloration of the `sclera` (FMA:58269).

column4: 前房异常（FMA:58078），前房是指角膜后面、虹膜前面的空间。
column5: Abnormality of the `anterior chamber` (FMA:58078), which is the space in the eye that is behind the cornea and in front of the iris.

column4: 前房深度降低，角膜和虹膜之间的前后距离减小。
column5: Reduced depth of the anterior chamber, i.e., the anteroposterior distance between the cornea and the iris is decreased.

column4: 眼肌麻痹是指控制眼球运动的一个或多个肌肉瘫痪或肌力降低。
column5: Ophthalmoplegia is a paralysis or weakness of one or more of the muscles that control eye movement.
An abnormality of the `ear` (FMA:52780).

column4: 瞳距比平均值小2个标准偏差（或，表现为瞳距过短或双眼间距过短）。
column5: Interpupillary distance less than 2 SD above the mean (alternatively, the appearance of an decreased interpupillary distance or closely spaced eyes).

column4: 一个或多个控制眼球运动的肌肉功能减弱。
column5: The ability of one or muscles control the eye movement reduced.

column4: 视物时视野中央部存在暗区并干扰中央视觉。
column5: An area of depressed vision located at the point of fixation and that interferes with central vision.

column4: 核上性凝视麻痹是由于脑损伤，在特定方向上无法视物的疾病。眼球有自主运动丧失，但是由于脑干仍然完好，所有的反射共轭眼球运动正常。
column5: A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a particular direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.

column4: 眼眶周围区域的异常。
column5: An abnormality of the region situated around the orbit of the eye.

column4: 黄斑中心凹的变性（FMA:58637）。
column5: Degeneration of the `macula lutea` (FMA:58637).

column4: 视神经发育不良（FMA:50863）。
column5: Underdevelopment of the `optic nerve` (FMA:50863).

column4: 在脉络膜上发生的异常（FMA:58298）。
column5: An abnormality of the `choroid` (FMA:58298).

column4: 先天性缺陷，其中脉络膜一部分发育不良和视网膜的对应区域是萎缩。
column5: A congenital defect in which a portion of choroid is not developed and the corresponding region of the retina is atrophic.
A `coloboma` (HP:0000589) of the `iris` (FMA:58235).

column4: 暴露在强光下时发生的眼睛对光过度敏感与不适或疼痛。
column5: Excessive sensitivity to light with the sensation of discomfort or pain in the eyes due to exposure to bright light.

column5: An abnormality of the nasolacrimal drainage system, which serves as a conduit for tear flow from the external eye to the nasal cavity.

column4: 瞳孔的异常（FMA:58252）。

column5: Abnormal (non-physiological) constriction of the pupil.

column4: 一个异常的眼运动`（HP:0000496），特点是眼球平稳追踪运动异常。
column5: An `abnormality of eye movement` (HP:0000496) characterized by impaired smooth-pursuit eye movements.

column4: 鼻泪囊中发生的炎症。
column5: Inflammation of the nasolacrimal sac.

column5: An inward turning (inversion) of the eyelid margin.

column5: Lack of sharpness of vision resulting in the inability to see fine detail.

column5: A posterior embryotoxon is the presence of a prominent and anteriorly displaced `line of Schwalbe` (FMA:58422).

column4: 虹膜的显著蓝色着色。
column5: A markedly blue coloration of the iris.

column5: A short discontinuity of the margin of the `upper eyelid` (FMA:54439).

column5: Distance between medial and lateral canthi is more than two standard deviations above the mean for age (objective); or, apparently increased length of the palpebral fissures.

column4: 一种规律性，非自主的单眼或双眼震颤，震颤的双眼不能固视、共轭凝视，或前庭病变。
column5: Rhythmic, involuntary oscillations of one or both eyes related to abnormality in fixation, conjugate gaze, or vestibular mechanisms.

column4: 眼球震颤在向右或向左凝视的时候变得明显。
column5: Nystagmus made apparent by looking to the right or to the left.

column4: 眼球扫视时的控制器信号有两个组成部分:脉冲控制眼球从一点到另一点快速移动，之后保持眼睛在该位置不动。当脉冲和凝视不匹配时，dysmetric再注视即发生了。
column5: The controller signal for saccadic eye movements has two components: the pulse that moves the eye rapidly from one point to the next, and the step that holds the eye in the new position. When both the pulse and the step are not the correct size, a dysmetric refixation eye movement results.

column4: 识别红色和绿色色调困难。
column5: Difficulty with discriminating red and green hues.

column4: 影响眼睑和额头的肌肉局部肌张力障碍，伴有双眼睑不自主复发性痉挛。
column5: A focal dystonia that affects the muscles of the eyelids and brow, associated with involuntary recurrent spasm of both eyelids.

column4: 无法利用镜片矫正的视力敏度下降，眼球和视觉通路无可见的解剖学缺陷。
column5: Reduced visual acuity that is uncorrectable by lenses in the absence of detectable anatomic defects in the eye or visual pathways.

column4: 先天性异常，其中部分或全部的角膜获得巩膜的特性，从而导致角膜混浊。
column5: A congenital anomaly in which a part or the whole of the cornea acquires the characteristics of sclera, resulting in clouding of the cornea.

column4: 视神经萎缩是由于视网膜神经节细胞轴突死亡所致，表现为眼底检查中视神经乳头颜色灰暗。

column5: An anomaly of visually evoked potentials (VEP), which are electrical potentials, initiated by brief visual stimuli, which are recorded from the scalp overlying the visual cortex.

column2: Reduced amplitude of pattern visual evoked potentials

column4: 复视是指一个对象被感知为两个图像。
column5: Diplopia is a condition in which a single object is perceived as two images, it is also known as double vision.

column4: 下眼睑的下沿存在断裂。
column5: A short discontinuity of the margin of the `lower eyelid` (FMA:54442).

column4: 睫毛密度降低或数量减少。
column5: Decreased density/number of eyelashes.

column4: 视网膜电图上的电反应幅度降低。
column5: Descreased amplitude of eletrical response upon electroretinography.

column4: 玻璃体和视网膜的渐进性变性。
column5: Gradual deterioration of the vitreous humor and retina.

column5: An outward turning (eversion) or rotation of the eyelid margin.

column4: 不自主的提睑肌抑制及眼轮匝肌抑制。是老年人帕金森病的典型体征之一。
column5: Eyelid apraxia is manifested as involuntary levator muscle suppression and orbicularis oculi muscle inhibition. It is one of the typical signs of Parkinson's disease in the elderly.

column4: 眼前段异常的一种综合征，前房异常缺失，通常表现为中央，中央旁，或完全的角膜混浊。
column5: A form of anterior segment dysgenesis in which abnormal cleavage of the anterior chamber occurs. Peters anomaly is characterized by central, paracentral, or complete corneal opacity.

column4: 视网膜血管有乳脂状的外观，当血液中的脂质浓度极度增大，视网膜血管呈现浅粉色到乳白色，脉络膜血管浅反射改变。
column5: A creamy appearance of the retinal blood vessels that occurs when the concentration of lipids in the blood are extremely increased, with pale pink to milky white retinal vessels and altered pale reflexes from choroidal vasculature.

column4: 在夜间或光线不佳时视物不清。
column5: Inability to see well at night or in poor light.

column4: 两侧眉毛在中线处（FMA:54237）会合。

column5: Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements.

column5: Atrophy of the eyeball with blindness and decreased intraocular pressure due to end-stage intraocular disease.

column4: 牙齿数量减少的发育异常，可多达6颗牙齿缺失。
column5: A developmental anomaly characterized by a `reduced number of` (PATO:0001999) teeth, whereby up to 6 teeth are missing.

column4: 龋齿是影响牙齿结构的多因素细菌感染。该术语被用于描述的比预期更多的龋齿存在。
column5: Caries is a multifactorial bacterial infection affecting the structure of the tooth. This term has been used to describe the presence of more than expected dental caries.

column4: 先天性缺失所有牙齿。

column5: A developmental anomaly characterized by a `reduced number of` (PATO:0001999) teeth, whereby more than 6 teeth are missing.

column5: Dental malocclusion refers to an abnormality of the occlusion, or alignment, of the teeth and the way the upper and lower teeth fit together, resulting in overcrowding of teeth or in abnormal bite patterns.

column5: `Decreased size` (PATO:0000587) of the `teeth` (FMA:12516), which can be defined as a mesiodistal tooth diameter (width) more than 2 SD below mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased maximum width of tooth.

column5: Abnormal alignment, positioning, or spacing of the teeth, i.e., `misaligned` (PATO:0001654) `teeth` (FMA:12516).

column4: 一种累及牙本质的牙齿发育不全，表现为牙髓腔增大，牙本质减少。

column4: 在`神经系统`的异常（FMA:7157）。
