column5: Hypercortisolemia associated with a primary defect of the adrenal gland leading to overproduction of cortisol.

column3: 色素性小结节状肾上腺皮质疾病

column4: 指多次发生的皮肤感染。
column5: Infections of the skin that happen multiple times.

column4: 失去弹性而表现出松散下垂的皮肤。
column5: Loose and sagging skin often associated with loss of skin elasticity.

column4: 眼球震颤的一种形式，眼球绕轴旋转。
column5: A form of nystagmus in which the eyeball makes rotary motions around the axis.

column4: 膀胱与阴道之间形成瘘道。
column5: The presence of a `fistula` (MPATH:70) connecting the `urinary bladder` (FMA:15900) to the `vagina` (FMA:19949).

column4: 卵巢功能异常，使女孩从未发生月经来潮。
column5: Malfunctioning of the ovaries such that a girl never begins menstruation.

column4: 该肋骨有一个广口钟的形状。即，肋笼的上部分收缩，接下来是一个凸区域肋笼下部再扩展为大直径。
column5: The rib cage has the shape of a wide mouthed bell. That is, the superior portion of the rib cage is constricted, follwed by a convex region, and the inferior portion of the rib cage expands again to have a large diameter.

column4: 只累及中切牙、小臼齿或大臼齿之中某一类的发育不全。
column5: `Agenesis` (MPATH:57) specifically affecting one of the classes `incisor` (FMA:12823), `premolar` (FMA:55637), or `molar` (FMA:55638).

column4: 上颌恒切牙的尺寸减少。
column5: `Decreased size` (PATO:0000587) of the `maxillary permanent incisor` (FMA:55713).

column4: 毛发的异常。
column5: An abnormality of the `hair` (FMA:53667).

column4: 头部或躯体毛发的脱失。
column5: Loss of hair from the head or body.

column4: 指（趾）甲的异常。
column5: Abnormality of the `nail` (FMA:54326).

column4: 甲先天纵向（后侧末端）凸拱不存在或反转。
column5: The natural longitudinal (posterodistal) convex arch is not present or is inverted.

column4: 喉部（FMA:55097）的异常。
column5: An abnormality of the `larynx` (FMA:55097).

column4: 喉软骨软化是一种先天发育畸形，表现为吸气时喉软骨松软和塌陷。
column5: Laryngomalacia is a congenital abnormality of the laryngeal cartilage in which the cartilage is floppy and prolapses over the larynx during inspiration.

column4: 喉部受限或狭窄，可伴有与喉狭窄程度相关呼吸困难。
column5: Stricture or narrowing of the larynx that may be associated with symptoms of respiratory difficulty depending on the degree of laryngeal narrowing.

column4: 声带运动能力减弱。
column5: `Decreased strength` (PATO:0001779) of the `vocal folds` (FMA:55457).

column4: 声带运动能力丧失（FMA:55457）。
column5: A loss of the ability to move the `vocal folds` (FMA:55457).

column2: Vocal cord paralysis (caused by tumor impingement)
column3: 声带麻痹（肿瘤侵犯导致）

column4: 嗓音的任何异常。
column5: Any abnormality of the voice.

column4: 声音嘶哑是指声音的音调或质量的变化，声音听起来虚弱，带着很重的呼吸声，有摩擦音或沙哑。
column5: Hoarseness refers to a change in the pitch or quality of the voice, with the voice sounding weak, very breathy, scratchy, or husky.

column4: 一种构音特点，讲话时因鼻腔气流异常增加所致，与软腭关闭不全或削弱有关。
column5: A type of speech characterized by the presence of an abnormally increased nasal airflow during speech, associated with incomplete or weak closure of the velum.

column3: 声音嘶哑（因肿瘤挤压所致）

column4: 产生声音的能力减弱。
column5: An impairment in the ability to produce voice sounds.

column4: 嗓音音调（频率）的异常升高。
column5: An abnormal increase in the pitch (frequency) of the voice.

column4: 语音的强度（音量）减弱。
column5: Reduced intensity (volume) of speech.

column4: 是指妊娠不足37周间分娩者。
column5: The birth of a baby of less than 37 weeks of gestational age.

column4: 胎儿进入产道中的先露部位为臀部或足。
column5: A position of the fetus at delivery in which the fetus enters the birth canal with the buttocks or feet first.

column4: 心血管系统的异常（FMA:7161）。
column5: Any abnormality of the `cardiovascular system` (FMA:7161).

column4: 心脏形态的异常（FMA:7088）。
column5: A morphological abnormality of the `heart` (FMA:7088).

column4: 心脏的两个底部室（心室）之间出现孔洞。缺损一般围绕室间隔上方出现。
column5: A hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart. The defect is centered around the most superior aspect of the ventricular septum.

column4: 房间隔缺损（ASD）是房间隔的先天性畸形，能够导致左心房和右心房之间的血液流通（FMA:7108）。
column5: Atrial septal defect (ASD) is a congenital abnormality of the `interatrial septum` (FMA:7108) that enables blood flow between the left and right atria via the interatrial septum.

column4: 二尖瓣的异常（FMA:7235）。
column5: An abnormality of the `mitral valve` (FMA:7235).

column4: 左心房收缩时一个或两个二尖瓣小叶（尖）向后隆起到左心室。
column5: One or both of the leaflets (cusps) of the mitral valve bulges back into the left atrium upon contraction of the left ventricle.

column4: 心脏组织或压力的异常升高迫使心脏泵血的速度不符合组织对血液的需求，导致心脏功能出现异常。心脏衰竭常与心肌收缩缺陷有关。
column5: The presence of an abnormality of cardiac function that is responsible for the failure of the heart to pump blood at a rate that is commensurate with the needs of the tissues or a state in which abnormally elevated filling pressures are required for the heart to do so. Heart failure is frequently related to a defect in myocardial contraction.

column4: 一种先天性心脏畸形疾病，包括肺动脉狭窄，主动脉骑跨，室间隔缺损和右心室肥厚。 至少存在四个上述特征种的三个时可被诊断为法洛四联症。
column5: A congenital cardiac malformation comprising pulmonary stenosis, overriding aorta, ventricular septum defect, and right ventricular hypertrophy. The diagnosis of TOF is made if at least three of the four above mentioned features are present.

column4: 心肌的异常。
column5: An abnormality of the myocardium.

column4: 心肌结构和功能异常的心肌疾病，在没有冠心病、高血压、心脏瓣膜病以及先天性心脏病的条件下观察到的心肌异常。
column5: A myocardial disorder in which the heart muscle is structurally and functionally abnormal, in the absence of coronary artery disease, hypertension, valvular disease and congenital heart disease sufficient to cause the observed myocardial abnormality.

column4: 肥厚性心肌病（HCM）是指在没有继发因素（高血压，瓣膜疾病）的情况下心室壁发生肥厚的一类疾病。
column5: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) is defined by the presence of increased ventricular wall thickness or mass in the absence of loading conditions (hypertension, valve disease) sufficient to cause the observed abnormality.

column4: 心脏（FMA:7088）体积的扩大(PATO:0000586)。
column5: `Increased size`  of the `heart` (FMA:7088).

column4: 肺动脉瓣的异常（FMA:7246）。
column5: An abnormality of the `pulmonary valve` (FMA:7246).

column4: 在肺动脉瓣（瓣膜狭窄）或略低于肺动脉瓣的部位（漏斗部狭窄）发生右心室流出道的变窄。
column5: A narrowing of the right ventricular outflow tract that can occur at the pulmonary valve (valvular stenosis) or just below the pulmonary valve (infundibular stenosis).

column4: 在子宫内，动脉导管（DA）通过将主肺动脉连接到降主动脉，使得心室输出的血液从肺分流，向胎盘转移。在出生后的前3天，在健康情况和早产新生儿中，动脉导管（PDA）生理性闭合，通常在出生后约24小时之内基本关闭，约三个星期后完全关闭。生理性关闭失败则为持续性动脉导管未闭（PDA）。根据从左到右分流的程度，动脉导管未闭可能导致临床后果。
column5: In utero, the ductus arteriosus (DA) serves to divert ventricular output away from the lungs and toward the placenta by connecting the main pulmonary artery to the descending aorta. A patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) in the first 3 days of life is a physiologic shunt in healthy term and preterm newborn infants, and normally is substantially closed within about 24 hours after bith and completely closed after about three weeks. Failure of physiologcal closure is referred to a persistent or patent ductus arteriosus (PDA). Depending on the degree of left-to-right shunting, PDA can have clinical consequences.

column4: 扩张型心肌病（DCM）被定义为，不存在其他异常病态（包括高血压、瓣膜病）或者冠心病的条件下，左心室扩张以及左心室收缩功能异常，造成系统性收缩障碍。可能存在右心室扩张和功能障碍，但不是诊断的必要条件。
column5: Dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) is defined by the presence of left ventricular dilatation and left ventricular systolic dysfunction in the absence of abnormal loading conditions (hypertension, valve disease) or coronary artery disease sufficient to cause global systolic impairment. Right ventricular dilation and dysfunction may be present but are not necessary for the diagnosis.

column4: 心脏意外地突然停止跳动，很短时间内发生死亡（一般在发病1小时以内）。
column5: The heart suddenly and unexpectedly stops beating resulting in death within a short time period (generally within 1 h of symptom onset).

column4: 主动脉瓣的异常（FMA:7236）。
column5: Any abnormality of the `aortic valve` (FMA:7236).

column4: 主动脉瓣只有两个瓣膜，而不是正常的三个瓣膜。
column5: The presence of an `aortic valve` (FMA:7236) with two instead of the normal three cusps (flaps).

column4: 肺动脉和右心室慢性高血压引起的右心衰竭。
column5: Right-sided heart failure resulting from chronic hypertension in the pulmonary arteries and right ventricle.

column4: 心脏搏动速率极快，心率通常在100次每秒以上。
column5: Excessive rapidity in the action of the heart,usually with a heart rate above 100 beats per minute.

column4: 主动脉瓣狭窄（缩小）。
column5: The presence of a stenosis (narrowing) of the aortic valve.

column4: 心脏位于胸腔的右边，也就是说，心脏的解剖位置存在一个左-右反转（或“镜像”），心脏位于右侧，而不是左侧。
column5: The heart is located in the right hand sided hemithorax. That is, there is a left-right reversal (or "mirror reflection") of the anatomical location of the heart in which the heart is locate on the right side instead of the left.

column4: 一种“二尖瓣异常”（HP:0001633），其特征是心室收缩过程中由于二尖瓣发育不全或无力，导致血液通过二尖瓣逆流、渗漏。
column5: An `abnormality of the mitral valve` (HP:0001633) characterized by insufficiency or incompetence of the mitral valve resulting in retrograde leaking of blood through the mitral valve upon ventricular contraction.

column4: 心脏瓣膜的异常（FMA:7110）。
column5: An abnormality of a `Cardiac valve` (FMA:7110).

column4: 婴儿出生后卵圆孔未能闭合，导致左、右心房间存在一潜在的导管。
column5: Failure of the foramen ovale to seal postnatally, leaving a potential conduit between the left and right cardiac atria.

column4: 由心电图（EKG）测量的从Q波的起始至T波结束的时间过长。
column5: Increased time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).

column4: 心脏血液供应的阻塞导致心肌坏死，并常伴有胸痛，气短，心悸，焦虑以及特征性的心电图结果和血清标志物肌酸激酶MB分数和肌钙蛋白升高。
column5: Necrosis of the myocardium caused by an obstruction of the blood supply to the heart and often associated with chest pain, shortness of breath, palpitations, and anxiety as well as characteristic EKG findings and elevation of serum markers including creatine kinase-MB fraction and troponin.

column4: 主动脉瓣的功能不全，导致血液从主动脉反流到左心室。
column5: An insufficiency of the aortic valve, leading to regurgitation (backward flow) of blood from the aorta into the left ventricle.

column4: 起源于心脏的单一动脉干。肺动脉，主动脉和冠状动脉均源于这个单一的主干而不是其他流出道。
column5: A single arterial trunk arises from the cardiac mass. The pulmonary arteries, aorta and coronary arteries arise from this single trunk with no evidence of another outflow tract.

column4: 比正常心率慢（成人心率每分钟少于60次）。
column5: A slower than normal heart rate (in adults, slower than 60 beats per minute).

column4: 不产生左心室收缩的情况下左心室肌肉纤维不受控的收缩。心室颤动通常始于室性早搏和短期的室性心动过速造成的不协调的短期心室纤维性颤动。
column5: Uncontrolled contractions of muscles fibers in the left ventricle not producing contraction of the left ventricle. Ventricular fibrillation usually begins with a ventricular premature contraction and a short run of rapid ventricular tachycardia degenerating into uncoordinating ventricular fibrillations.

column3: 尖端扭转型室性心动过速
column4: 一种室性心动过速，其特征为多种形态的QRS波群改变了原有振幅和周期长度，因而在心电图中围绕基线出现振荡。
column5: A type of ventricular tachycardia characterized by polymorphioc QRS complexes that change in amplitue and cycle length, and thus have the appearance of oscillating around the baseline in the EKG.

column4: 右心室的扩张。通常是由于肺动脉高压引起心室质量的增加，也导致心血管疾病的发病率和死亡率增加。
column5: Enlargement of the right ventricle of the heart. This increase in ventricular mass is often attributed to pulmonary hypertension and is a contributor to cardiovascular morbidity and mortality.

column4: 最常见的新生儿紫绀型先天性心脏疾病。最典型的表现为心室大动脉连接异常，主动脉起自形态学上的右心室而肺动脉起自形态学上的左心室。
column5: The most common cyanotic congenital heart lesion that presents in neonates. The hallmark of transposition of the great arteries is ventriculoarterial discordance, in which the aorta arises from the morphologic right ventricle and the pulmonary artery arises from the morphologic left ventricle.

column4: 以不对称性肥厚为特征的一种心肌病，主要是室间隔肥厚和心肌排列紊乱，干扰了左心室的血液排空。
column5: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy with an asymmetrical pattern of hypertrophy, with a predilection for the interventricular septum and myocyte disarray.

column4: 左心与右心间隔部分的异常，即心房内或心室内隔膜的异常。
column5: An anomaly of the intra-atrial or intraventricular septum.

column3: 心动过速（伴有嗜铬细胞瘤）
column4: 心脏运动速率极快，通常在100次每秒以上（伴有嗜铬细胞瘤）。
column5: Excessive rapidity in the action of the heart,usually with a heart rate above 100 beats per minute.

column4: 一种先天性的心脏缺陷，其特征为房间隔缺损，室间隔缺损，房室瓣正常。
column5: A congenital heart defect characteizred by a specific combination of heart defects with a common atrioventricular valve, primum atrial septal defect and inlet ventricular septal defect.

column3: 嗜铬细胞瘤相关性心脏节律紊乱
column4: 由嗜铬细胞瘤分泌过量儿茶酚胺所引起的心律失常
column5: Cardiac arrhythmias associated with pheochromocytoma－caused excessive catecholamine secretion

column4: 心悸（伴嗜铬细胞瘤）
column5: Palpitations (with pheochromocytoma)

column4: 冠状动脉壁内粥样斑块的积聚导致冠状动脉直径减小，增加了心肌缺血的风险。
column5: Reduction of the diameter of the coronary arteries as the result of an accumulation of atheromatous plaques within the walls of the coronary arteries, which increases the risk of myocardial ischemia.

column4: 房室结介导的心房去极化向心室传导的延迟或阻滞。
column5: Delayed or lack of conduction of atrial depolarizations through the atrioventricular node to the ventricles.

column4: 主动脉的异常（FMA:3734）。
column5: An abnormality of the `aorta` (FMA:3734).

column4: 主动脉节段性的狭窄或阻塞。
column5: Coarctation of the aorta is a narrowing or constriction of a segment of the aorta.

column4: 用力过度或应激状态引起的突发性胸痛，与心肌缺血有关。
column5: Paroxysmal chest pain that occurs with exertion or stress and is related to myocardial ischemia.

column4: 血液流经左室流出道时发生梗阻，与主动脉瓣下狭窄有关。
column5: A fixed form of obstruction to blood flow across the `left-ventricular outflow tract` (FMA:9473) related to stenosis (narrowing) below the level of the aortic valve.

column4: 通过腹壁上的裂缝，心脏部分或者全部暴露在胸腔外的先天腹壁畸形。
column5: Congenital malformation of the ventral wall with partial or total evisceration of the heart outside the thoracic cavity and through the defect in the ventral wall.

column4: 一种`房间隔缺损`（HP:0001631），由卵圆孔扩大，第二房间隔发育不全，或第一房间隔过度吸收引起。
column5: A kind of `atrial septum defect`（HP:0001631） arising from an enlarged foramen ovale, inadequate growth of the septum secundum, or excessive absorption of the septum primum.

column4: 心肌纤维化是指心肌组织中成纤维细胞异常增殖。
column5: Cardiac fibrosis commonly refers to the proliferation of fibroblasts in the cardiac muscle.

column4: 心动过缓指的是静息状态下平均窦性心率少于每分钟50次。
column5: Bradycardia related to a mean resting sinus rate of less than 50 beats per minute.

column4: 一类室间隔肌肉增厚引起的主动脉瓣下狭窄，这导致血液流经左心室流出道受阻。
column5: A type of subvalvular aortic stenosis resulting from thickening of the musculature of the interventricular septum, which results in obstruction to blood flow though the left-ventricular outflow tract.

column4: 阵发性室上性心搏过速的一种，是原发性的心脏电生理传导紊乱。
column5: A type of supraventricular tachycardia in which the atria are the principal site of electrophysiologic disturbance.

column4: 偏离正常血液循环的心脏血流模式。
column5: Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system.

column4: 血液在心脏流动的回路发生异常，出现从右向左流动。
column5: Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from the right side of the heart to the left.

column4: 心脏骤停也称为心肺骤停或循环骤停，由心脏收缩功能部分或完全丧失，导致血液循环突然停止。
column5: Cardiac arrest, also known as cardiopulmonary arrest or circulatory arrest, is a sudden stop in effective blood circulation due to the failure of the heart to contract effectively or at all.

column4: 胸腹主要器官的解剖学位置左右反转（或“镜面反射”）。
column5: A left-right reversal (or "mirror reflection") of the anatomical location of the major thoracic and abdominal organs.

column4: 心包异常是指包绕在心脏和和大血管根部(如主动脉近端，腔静脉，和肺动脉)外的双层囊性结构发生异常。
column5: An abnormality of the `pericardium` (FMA:9869), i.e., of the  fluid filled sac that surrounds the heart and the proximal ends of the aorta, vena cava, and the pulmonary artery.

column4: 心包内液体积累。
column5: Accumulation of fluid within the pericardium.
Rapid and unexpected death.

column4: 心肌坏死。
column5: Myocardial cells take place necrosis

column4: 包裹在心脏周围的囊状物（心包）发生的炎症反应。
column5: Inflammation of the sac-like covering around the heart (pericardium).

column4: 右房室瓣即三尖瓣的异常（FMA:7234）。
column5: An abnormality of the `tricuspid valve` (FMA:7234).

column4: 右心室收缩时三尖瓣瓣膜的一个或多个瓣叶（尖）的向后凸出进入右心房。
column5: One or more of the leaflets (cusps) of the tricuspid valve bulges back into the right atrium upon contraction of the right ventricle.

column4: 法洛四联症特征之一，右心室流出道狭窄或梗阻可位于漏斗部，肺动脉瓣膜部，肺动脉瓣环，肺动脉主干或肺动脉分支。
column5: One feathers of the tetralogy of fallot, right ventricular outlet get narrowing or obstructing in infundibulum, infundibulum, pulmonary valve ring, main pulmonary artery or branch pulmonary artery.

column3: 心内膜弹力纤维增生症
column4: 一种疾病状态，以左心室壁肥厚、心内膜外包裹一层厚的弹力纤维组织帽为特征，心室功能偶有降低，但通常增强。
column5: A condition characterized by hypertrophy of the wall of the left ventricle and conversion of the endocardium into a thick fibroelastic coat,with the capacity of the ventricle sometimes reduced,but often increased.

column4: 心脏右心室的异常（FMA:7098）。
column5: An abnormality of the `right ventricle` (FMA:7098) of the heart.

column4: 右心室行使其功能的能力（从肺动脉接收血液和将血液泵入右心房）减弱，经常导致外周性水肿，腹水和肝肿大。
column5: Reduced ability of the right ventricle to perform its function (to receive blood from the right atrium and to eject blood into the pulmonary artery), often leading top pitting peripheral edema, ascites, and hepatomegaly.

column4: 房室传导阻滞的一种，心房的冲动无法传导到心室。
column5: A form of  atrioventricular block  in which atrial impulse propagates to the ventricles.

column4: 先天性心脏流出道畸形。圆锥动脉干畸形被认为是由于胚胎时期心脏流出道畸形造成的，包括动脉干永存，法洛四联症，主动脉弓中断，大动脉转位以及右心室双出口。
column5: A congenital malformation of the outflow tract of the heart. Conotruncal defects are thought to result from a disturbance of the outflow tract of the embryonic heart, and comprise truncus arteriosus, tetralogy of Fallot, interrupted aortic arch, transposition of the great arteries, and double outlet right ventricle.

column4: 心脏左心室的异常（7101 FMA）。
column5: An abnormality of the `left ventricle` (FMA:7101) of the heart.

column4: 由于长期压力或容量负荷异常引起的心脏左心室扩张，是由心室质量增大形成的，是心血管病发病和死亡的一个重要原因。
column5: Enlargement of the left ventricle of the heart. This increase in ventricular mass is attributed to sustained abnormal pressure or volume loads and is a contributor to cardiovascular morbidity and mortality.

column4: 心脏心室的异常（FMA:7100）。
column5: An abnormality of a `cardiac ventricle` (FMA:7100).

column4: 心脏心室肌肉组织扩大、心室壁增宽并失去弹性。心室肥厚在临床上分为左，右心室肥厚。
column5: Enlargement of the cardiac ventricular muscle tissue with increase in the width of the wall of the ventricle and loss of elasticity. Ventricular hypertrophy is clinically differentiated into left and right ventricular hypertrophy.

column4: 由于房室附加通路产生异常冲动,造成心室提前激动的一种心脏传导系统紊乱疾病。
column5: A disorder of the cardiac conduction system of the heart characterized by ventricular preexcitation due to the presence of an abnormal accessory atrioventricular electrical conduction pathway.

column4: 钙化（PATO:0001447），即钙盐的病理性沉积，影响`冠状动脉`（FMA:3800）。
column5: `Calcification` (PATO:0001447), that is, pathological  deposition of calcium salts, affecting  the `coronary arteries` (FMA:3800).

column4: 二尖瓣的孔口异常狭窄。
column5: Ab abnormal narrowing of the orifice of the mitral valve.

column4: 右室双出口（DORV）是一种心室与动脉的异常连接，指两个大血管（主动脉和肺动脉）完全或主要从右心室发出。
column5: Double outlet right ventricle (DORV) is a type of ventriculoarterial connection in which both great vessels arise entirely or predominantly from the right ventricle.

column3: 高输出充血性心脏衰竭
column4: 心输出量升高的一种心力衰竭形式。这可能发生在患有心脏衰竭和甲状腺功能亢进症，贫血，妊娠，动静脉瘘和其他疾病的患者中。
column5: A form of heart failure characterized by elevated cardiac output. This may be seen in patients with heart failure and hyperthyroidism, anemia, pregnancy, arteriovenous fistulae, and others.

column4: 限制性心肌病是一类心室壁过分坚硬，阻碍心室充盈的心肌病，其特征为心脏舒张功能异常，而收缩功能却正常或几乎正常。
column5: Myocardial disease in which the ventricular walls are excessively rigid,impeding ventricular filling; it is marked by abnormal diastolic function but by normal or nearly normal systolic function.

column4: 主动脉增大，超过正常大小。
column5: Aorta enlarge to greater than normal size.

column4: 瓣膜病发病率增加
column5: Increased prevalence of valvular disease

column4: 由于血栓栓塞发生脑血管意外（脑卒中/中风）。
column5: A cerebrovascular accident (stroke) that occurs because of thromboembolism.
An abnormality of the `ear` (FMA:52780).

column4: 胰腺的异常。
column5: An abnormality of the `pancreas` (FMA:7198).

column4: 存在于胰腺的炎症。
column5: The presence of `inflammation` (MPATH:212) in the `pancreas` (FMA:7198).

column4: 一种胰腺先天异常：胰腺完全（有时候不完全）环绕十二指肠第二段，且偶尔会阻塞更近段的十二指肠。
column5: A congenital anomaly in which the pancreas completely (or sometimes incompletely) encircles the second portion of duodenum and occasionally obstructs the more proximal duodenum.

column4: 一种急性形式的胰腺炎。
column5: A `acute` (PATO:0000389) form of `pancreatitis` (HP:0001733).

column4: 被覆粘膜上皮的胰腺囊肿。
column5: A cyst of the pancreas that possess a lining of mucous epithelium.
Impaired function of the exocrine pancreas associated with a reduced ability to digest foods because of lack of digestive enzymes.

column4: 男性的包皮不能完全从龟头后缩（让龟头露出来）。
column5: The male foreskin cannot be fully retracted from the head of the penis.

column4: 降低空气通过鼻腔的能力，常常导致用口呼吸。
column5: Reduced ability to pass air through the nasal cavity often leading to mouth breathing.

column4: 脾脏的异常。
column5: An abnormality of the `spleen` (FMA:7196).

column4: 脾脏尺寸异常增加。
column5: Abnormal `increased size` (PATO:0000586) of the `spleen` (FMA:7196).

column4: 脾的缺失（不发育）。
column5: Absence (aplasia) of the `spleen` (FMA:7196).

column4: 副脾为一个圆形的、等超声波回声的、均质且光滑的结构，是一种正常变异，其多数位于脾的内侧轮廓，邻近门区或在下极周围。无致病相关性。
column5: An accessory spleen is a round, iso-echogenic, homogenic and smooth structure and is seen as a normal variant mostly on the medial contour of the spleen, near the hilus or around the lower pole. This has no pathogenic relevance.

column4: 多脾是一种先天性疾病，表现为多个小的副脾。
column5: Polysplenia is a congenital disease manifested by multiple small accessory spleens.

column4: 心脏只有一个心室。
column5: The exist of single ventricle in the heart.

column4: 前庭器官的功能异常。
column5: An abnormality of the functioning of the vestibular apparatus.

column4: 前庭器官的功能减弱。
column5: Reduced functioning of the vestibular apparatus.

column3: 高频感音神经性听力障碍
column4: 以损害高频听力为主的“感音神经性听力障碍” （HP: 0008538）的类型。
column5: Reduced functioning of the vestibular apparatus.

column4: 足的骨骼异常。
column5: An abnormality of the `skeleton of foot` (FMA:24222).

column4: 足弓（FMA:43942）异常高。也称为高脚背，足弓是指承重时脚底与鞋底间的明显空间。
column5: The presence of an unusually high `plantar arch` (FMA:43942). Also called high instep, pes cavus refers to a distinctly hollow form of the sole of the foot when it is bearing weight.

column4: 马蹄内翻足通常有四个主要组成部分：前足折反内收、脚跟和足后部反转、踝关节和距下关节马蹄形（伸展受限）和腿向内旋转。
column5: Talipes equinovarus (also called clubfoot) typically has four main components: inversion and adduction of the forefoot; inversion of the heel and hindfoot; equinus (limitation of extension) of the ankle and subtalar joint; and internal rotation of the leg.

column4: 扁平足（FMA:43942）是当人直立时足底与地板或地面可以接触;或者在患者仰卧时，检查者用平板以预期负重的压力压紧脚底时两者表面接触;或者足弓的高度减小。
column5: A foot where the `plantar arch` (FMA:43942) is in contact with the ground or floor when the individual is standing; or, in a patient lying supine, a foot where the arch is in contact with the surface of a flat board pressed against the sole of the foot by the examiner with a pressure similar to that expected from weight bearing; or, the height of the arch is reduced.

column4: 跖骨过伸伴趾间关节过度屈曲。
column5: Hyperextension of the metatarsal-phalangeal joint with hyperflexion of the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint.

column4: 足部的测量宽度大于同龄人群的第95百分位数;或者过宽，与足的长度不成比例。
column5: A foot for which the measured width is above the 95th centile for age; or, a foot that appears disproportionately wide for its length.

column4: 脚趾间存在蹼或融合脚趾，可以仅涉及软组织或包括骨骼结构。发生在胫-腓轴线的骨性融合被称为“骨性并趾畸形”；脚趾在近-远端轴的骨性融合被称为“关节粘连”。
column5: Webbing or fusion of the toes, involving soft parts only or including bone structure. Bony fusions are revered to as "bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the toes in a proximo-distal axis are refered to as "Symphalangism".

column4: 在跟腱（FMA:51061）位置发生的挛缩。
column5: A contracture of the `Achilles tendon` (FMA:51061).

column4: 脚和踝关节变形，脚向下向外弯曲。
column5: A deformity of foot and ankle in which the foot is bent down and outwards.

column4: 27-41周的胎儿足的长度低于平均值2个标准差以上；出生-16岁的人群，足长度小于人群的第3百分位数（客观）。另外，足的长度与宽度出现不成比例短脚（主观）。
column5: A measured foot length that is more than 2 SD below the mean for a newborn of 27 - 41 weeks gestation, or foot that is less than the 3rd centile for individuals from birth to 16 years of age (objective). Alternatively, a foot that appears disproportionately short (subjective).

column4: 双侧马蹄内翻足畸形（请参阅HP:0001762）。
column5: Bilateral clubfoot deformity (see HP:0001762).

column4: 脚趾的异常。
column5: An anomaly of a `toe` (FMA:25046).

column4: 脚趾的形态学异常，脚趾尖突出形似球茎。
column5: An abnormality of the morphology of the toes, such that the tips of the toes are prominent and bulbous.

column4: 跖骨一侧到另一侧的宽度增加。
column5: Increased side-to-side width of a metatarsal bone.

column4: 足部宽度低于同龄人群第5百分位数;或者足的宽度与长度出现不成比例的狭窄足。
column5: A foot for which the measured width is below the 5th centile for age; or, a foot that appears disproportionately narrow for its length.

column4: 产程中出现异常。
column5: An abnormality of the birth process.

column4: 距临产时间超过1小时以上时发生的胎膜破裂。
column5: Premature rupture of membranes (PROM) is a condition which occurs in pregnancy when the amniotic sac ruptures more than an hour before the onset of labor.

column4: 两个或以上的胎儿体内腔隙出现异常液体积聚，包括腹水，胸水，心包积液和皮肤水肿。
column5: The abnormal accumulation of fluid in two or more fetal compartments, including ascites, pleural effusion, pericardial effusion, and skin edema.

column4: 非免疫性胎儿水肿是指胎儿体内出现两处或以上不同部位的体液异常聚积；但母体循环中没有抗胎儿红细胞抗体
column5: Nonimmune hydrops fetalis is a serious fetal condition in which abnormal fluid accumulates in at least two different compartments ,and in which ciruulating antibodies against red cell antigens are absent in the mother.

column4: 胎儿期腹腔内的液体积累。
column5: Accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity during the fetal period.

column4: 甲的长度和宽度变短或变窄，即未充分发育的甲。
column5: A nail that is diminished in length and width, i.e., underdeveloped `nail` (FMA:54326).

column4: 当检查者看向指（趾）尖部位时，可观察到甲表面有纵向凸起。
column5: When viewed on end (with the digit tip pointing toward the examiner's eye) the curve of the nail forms a tighter curve of convexity.

column4: 甲的发育不全。
column5: `Aplasia` (MPATH:58) of the `nail` (FMA:54326).

column4: 甲的长度较短。
column5: Decreased length of nail.

column4: 趾甲未发育完全。
column5: Underdevelopment of the `toenail`(FMA:54328).

column4: 先天性趾甲缺损。
column5: Congenital absence of the `toenail`(FMA:54328).

column4: 甲背面小的凹点（通常约1毫米或更小）。
column5: Small (typically about 1 mm or less in size) depressions on the dorsal nail surface.

column4: 指甲未发育完全。
column5: Underdevelopment of a `fingernail`(FMA:54327).

column4: 从甲的末端可以观察到甲增厚。
column5: Nail that appears thick when viewed on end.

column4: 甲板从甲床分离。
column5: Detachment of the nail from the nail bed.

column4: 甲板纵向线性突起。
column5: Longitudinal, linear prominences in the nail plate.

column4: 甲容易断裂。
column5: Nails that easily break.

column4: 甲板沿纵轴分裂但是沿横轴依然相连。
column5: A nail plate that has a longitudinal separation and the two sections of the nail share the same lateral radius of curvature.

column4: 趾甲异常包括颜色的改变（甲变色）和甲板部分或完全性毁损。
column5: Toenail changes apart from changes of the color of the toenail (nail dyschromia) that involve partial or complete disruption of the various keratinous layers of the nail plate.

column4: 当检查者看向指尖部位时可以观察到甲表面有纵向凸起。
column5: When viewed on end (with the finger tip pointing toward the examiner's eye) the curve of the fingernail forms a tighter curve of convexity.

column4: 甲长到皮肤里。
column5: Deeply placed nails.

column4: 从甲的末端可观察到甲变薄。
column5: Nail that appears thin when viewed on end.

column4: 指甲的缺损。
column5: Absence of a `fingernail`(FMA:54327).

column4: 甲沟炎常发生在甲侧缘或基底部，由常见易感细菌或真菌感染引起，感染可急性发生（急性甲沟炎）或慢性发展（慢性甲沟炎）。
column5: The nail disease paronychia is an often-tender bacterial or fungal hand infection or foot infection where the nail and skin meet at the side or the base of a finger or toenail. The infection can start suddenly (acute paronychia) or gradually (chronic paronychia).

column4: 甲褪色呈白色。
column5: White discoloration  of the `nails` (FMA:54326).

column4: 甲的宽度增加。
column5: Increased width of nail.

column4: 拇趾的横向偏差（即小趾方向）。
column5: Lateral deviation of the great toe (i.e., in the direction of the little toe).

column4: 体重减少。
column5: Reduction inexisting body weight.

column4: 生殖道的先天性管道闭塞。
column5: Congenital occlusion of a tube in the genital tract.

column4: 一种多趾畸形（HP:0010442），特点是存在额外的脚趾
column5: A kind of `polydactyly` (HP:0010442) characterized by the presence of a supernumerary toe or toes.

column4: 多趾畸形最常见的是单足存在六个脚趾。 轴后多趾形成影响外侧幅肋，此外重复可能形成形态良好的关节和趾，也可能形成非常初级的趾。
column5: Polydactyly of the foot most commonly refers to the presence of six toes on one foot. Postaxial polydactyly affects the lateral ray and the duplication may range from a well-formed articulated digit to a rudimentary digit.

column4: 脚趾（FMA:25046）与足部相比出现不成比例的短。
column5: A `toe` (FMA:25046) that appears disproportionately short compared to the foot.

column4: 跖骨的异常，跖骨是位于足后部和足中部的跗骨和脚趾的趾骨之间的五个管状骨。
column5: Abnormalities of the `metatarsal bones` (FMA:24492) (i.e. of five tubular bones located between the tarsal bones of the hind- and mid-foot and the phalanges of the toes).

column4: 足跟至前部的长度增加。
column5: Increased back to front length of the foot.

column4: 近端趾间关节逐步渐进的无痛屈曲挛缩。这个术语是指一个或多个脚趾屈曲畸形。
column5: Camptodactyly is a painless flexion contracture of the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint that is usually gradually progressive. This term refers to camptodactyly of one or more toes.

column4: 非拇趾的脚趾宽度明显增加而背腹间高度不增加。
column5: Visible increase in width of the non-hallux digit without an increase in the dorso-ventral dimension.

column4: 双足跟突出及鞋子可见凸出轮廓。
column5: The presence of both a prominent heel and a convex contour of the sole.

column4: 脚的中间部分（脚趾和跖骨）缺如，呈现劈裂外观。严重性变化很大，从第三脚趾轻度发育不良、第二或第三脚趾缺如，到寡趾或单趾脚。
column5: A condition in which middle parts of the foot (toes and metatarsals) are missing giving a cleft appearance. The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic 3rd toe over absent 2nd or 3rd toes as far as oligo- or monodactyl feet.

column4: 跖骨均向内侧偏离（胫侧），即前足部的骨骼向体侧弯曲或转动。
column5: The metatarsals are deviated medially (tibially), that is, the bones in the front half of the foot bend or turn in toward the body.

column4: 第一幅肋部分或全部重复。
column5: Duplication of all or part of the first ray.

column4: 本术语适用于大脚趾（也称为脚拇趾）的所有异常。
column5: This term applies for all abnormalities of the big toe, also called hallux.

column4: 描述静息状态时，一个足趾位于邻近的另一个足趾的背侧面上。
column5: Describes a foot digit resting on the dorsal surface of an adjacent digit when the foot is at rest.

column4: 拇趾（FMA:25047）的长度增加。
column5: Increased length of the `big toe` (FMA:25047).

column4: 足相对胫骨的姿势畸形。足跟（跟骨）向下（即踝向上弯曲）和向外翻转（外翻）。
column5: This is a postural deformity in which the foot is positioned up against the tibia. The heel (calcaneus) is positioned downward (that is, the ankle is flexed upward), and the heel is turned outward (valgus).

column4: 发育缺陷造成脚趾的数量少于正常数量。
column5: A developmental defect resulting in the presence of fewer than the normal number of toes.

column4: 跗骨的异常，跗骨是足部由七个骨头组成的骨头群，位于胫骨、腓骨和跖骨之间，包括跟骨（脚跟骨）和距骨（脚踝）骨。
column5: An abnormality of the tarsus are the cluster of seven bones in the foot between the tibia and fibula and the metatarsus, including the calcaneus (heel) bone and the talus (ankle) bone.

column4: 第一、二趾之间的间距增大。
column5: A widely spaced gap between the first toe (the great toe) and the second toe.

column4: 痛风（HP:0001997）影响大脚趾的跖趾关节。
column5: `Gout` (HP:0001997) affecting the `Metatarsophalangeal joint of big toe`.

column4: 远节趾骨（FMA:75830）从脚趾末端到趾远侧纹或远端趾间关节屈曲点距离异常短，即远节趾骨异常短。
column5: Short distance from the end of the toe to the most distal interphalangeal crease or distal interphalangeal joint flexion point, i.e., abnormally short `distal phalanx of toe` (FMA:75830).

column4: 先天性远端趾关节粘连

column2: Acral ulceration and osteomyelitis leading to autoamputation of the digits (feet)
column3: 肢端溃疡和骨髓炎导致脚趾自发性离断

column4: 脚趾向胫侧（即大脚趾侧）弯曲。
column5: Bending or curvature of a `toe` (FMA:25046) in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).

column4: 第五趾（FMA:25053）向胫侧（即大脚趾侧）弯曲
column5: Bending or curvature of a `fifth toe` (FMA:25053) in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).

column4: 跖部皮肤出现异常明显的皱褶（呈脊或皱纹）。
column5: The presence of unusually deep creases (ridges/wrinkles) on the `skin of sole of foot` (FMA:37849).

column2: Abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues
column4: 造血系统的异常（FMA:9667）。
column5: An abnormality of the `hematopoietic system` (FMA:9667).
An abnormality of `platelets` (CL:0000233).

column4: 血循环中血小板（:0000762 CL）的数量的减少。
column5: A reduction in the number of circulating `thrombocytes` (CL:0000762).

column4: 中性粒细胞（CL:0000775）异常。
column5: A `neutrophil` (CL:0000775) abnormality.

column4: 外周血中性粒细胞数目异常降低。
column5: An abnormally low number of `neutrophils` (CL:0000775) in the peripheral `blood` (FMA:9670).

column4: 所有血细胞类型的数目的异常降低（红细胞，白细胞，和血小板）。
column5: An abnormal reduction in numbers of all blood cell types (red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets).

column4: 红细胞异常（CL:0000232）（红血细胞）。
column5: An abnormality of `erythrocytes` (CL:0000232) (red-blood cells).

column4: 一型由红细胞（溶血）过早破坏引起的贫血。
column5: A type of anemia caused by premature destruction of red blood cells (hemolysis).

column4: 嗜酸性粒细胞（CL:0000771）异常。
column5: An `eosinophil` (CL:0000771) abnormality.

column4: 血中（FMA:9670）嗜酸粒细胞（CL:0000771）增加。
column5: Increased count of `eosinophils` (CL:0000771) in the `blood` (FMA:9670).

column4: 白细胞的异常（CL:0000738）。
column5: An abnormality of `leukocytes` (CL:0000738).

column4: 血液中白细胞（CL:0000738）的数量异常减少。
column5: An abnormal decreased number of `leukocytes` (CL:0000738) in the `blood` (FMA:9670).

column4: 足和踝部的变形，有不同的亚型:马蹄内翻足、马蹄外翻足、仰趾内翻足和仰趾外翻足。
column5: A deformity of foot and ankle that has different subtypes that are talipes equinovarus, talipes equinovalgus, talipes calcaneovarus and talipes calcaneovalgus.

column4: 仰趾外翻足是一种柔软的足畸形（相对于僵硬的先天性垂直型距骨变形足），可以任一形式出现，位置性的或结构性的足变形，取决于其严重性和/或病因。 仰趾外翻足变形的轴线是在胫距关节，足的位置处于极端过伸状态。脚呈现“向上向外”的外观，足背几乎接触到踝关节和小腿下端的前部。
column5: Talipes calcaneovalgus is a flexible foot deformity (as opposed to a rigid congenital vertical talus foot deformity) that can either present as a positional or structural foot deformity depending on severity and/or causality. The axis of calcaneovalgus deformity is in the tibiotalar joint, where the foot is positioned in extreme hyperextension. On inspection, the foot has an "up and out" appearance, with the dorsal forefoot practically touching the anterior aspect of the ankle and lower leg.

column4: '第二趾`不发达（发育不全）（FMA:25048）。

column5: An abnormality of the `glabella` (FMA:52851).

column4: 眉间向前突出。
column5: Forward protrusion of the `glabella` (FMA:52851).

column4: 面容呈现肌病状态。由于肌肉无力，面部呈现双颊凹陷，双侧上睑下垂，以及嘴角下垂状态。
column5: A facial appearance characteristic of myopathic conditions. The face appears expressionless with sunken cheeks, bilateral ptosis, and inability to elevate the corners of the mouth, due to muscle weakness.

column4: 大脑萎缩（缩小，细胞数量或组织体积减少）。
column5: Atrophy (wasting, decrease in size of cells or tissue) affecting the cerebrum.

column4: 大脑，也被称为`端脑`（FMA:62000）的异常。
column5: An abnormality of the `telencephalon` (FMA:62000), which is also known as the cerebrum.

column4: 特点是随着肌张力增高速度依赖的下肢牵张反射增加、腱反射亢进（高兴奋性）的运动障碍。
column5: A motor disorder characterized by a velocity-dependent increase in tonic stretch reflexes with increased muscle tone, exaggerated (hyperexcitable) tendon reflexes in the lower limbs.

column2: Morphological abnormality of the pyramidal tract
column4: 所有锥体束（FMA:72634）的结构异常，其主要成分，皮质脊髓束，是脑和脊髓之间唯一的直接连接。除了皮质脊髓束，锥体系统包括皮质延髓束，皮质中脑束，皮质脑桥束。
column5: Any structural abnormality of the `pyramidal tract` (FMA:72634), whose chief element, the corticospinal tract, is the only direct connection between the brain and the spinal cord. In addition to the corticospinal tract, the pyramidal system includes the corticobulbar, corticomesencephalic, and corticopontine tracts.

column4: 连续持续性不自主的肌肉收缩。当受影响的肌肉被动拉伸，无论肌肉的受牵拉稠度怎样，拮抗的程度保持恒定。此功能有助于区分肌肉痉挛还是强直。
column5: Continuous involuntary sustained muscle contraction. When an affected muscle is passively stretched, the degree of resistance remains constant regardless of the rate at which the muscle is stretched. This feature helps to distinguish rigidity from muscle spasticity.

column4: `共济失调`(HP:0001251)的一种类型，表现为正常行走时所需的协同运动能力受损。
column5: A type of `ataxia` (HP:0001251) characterized by the impairment of the ability to coordinate the movements required for normal walking.

column4: 运动迟缓的字面意思是缓慢运动，临床上用于表示运动执行缓慢（相对于运动减少，这是用来指运动的起始缓慢）。
column5: Bradykinesia literally means slow movement, and is used clinically to denote a slowness in the execution of movement (in contrast to hypokinesia, which is used to refer to slowness in the initiation of movement).

column3: 神经肌肉源性吞咽困难

column4: 全面性强直-阵挛发作是全面性发作（HP:0002197），躯体肌肉双侧对称性强直收缩，然后阵挛性收缩，通常伴有自主神经症状。
column5: Generalized tonic-clonic seizures are `generalized seizures` (HP:0002197) with bilateral symmetrical tonic contraction then bilateral clonic contractions of somatic muscles usually associated with autonomic phenomena.

column4: 影响肢体运动的一种共济失调（HP:0001251）。
column5: A kind of `ataxia` (HP:0001251) that affects movements of the extremities.

column4: 与基底节病变导致神经状态异常，典型的表现包括运动不能（无法启动动作，或不能迅速和容易地进行随意运动），肌强直（广泛的无节律的肌肉快速持续收缩），舞蹈症（普遍一个强制，快速，干，和不宁性质）的心律失常的动作，手足徐动症（不能维持手指，脚趾，或其他组的肌肉中的固定位置的肌肉），和静坐不能（不能保持不动）。
column5: A neurological condition related to lesions of the basal ganglia leading to typical abnormalities including akinesia (inability to initiate changes in activity and perform volitional movements rapidly and easily), muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement), chorea (widespread arrhythmic movements of a forcible, rapid, jerky, and restless nature), athetosis (inability to sustain the muscles of the fingers, toes, or other group of muscles in a fixed position), and akathisia (inability to remain motionless).

column4: 舞蹈样运动（希腊文“跳舞”），指的是广泛无节奏的不自主强行运动，表现为抽动样，坐立不安。
column5: Chorea (Greek for 'dance') refers to widespread arrhythmic involuntary movements of a forcible, jerky and restless fashion.

column3: 神经元自体荧光脂褐素增加
column4: 脂褐素，自体荧光脂褐素的专业术语，是积聚在最衰老细胞的蛋白质和脂质混合物，尤其是涉及高脂质转换（例如，肾上腺髓质）或吞噬的其他类型细胞（例如视网膜色素上皮细胞或RPE；巨噬细胞）。此术语适用于神经元脂褐素（也称为自身荧光脂蛋白）的积聚增加是否超过患者预期的年龄。
column5: Lipofuscin, a generic term applied to autofluorescent lipopigment, is a mixture of protein and lipid that accumulates in most aging cells, particularly those involved in high lipid turnover (e.g., the adrenal medulla) or phagocytosis of other cell types (e g., the retinal pigment epithelium or RPE; macrophage). This term pertains if there is an increase in the neuronal accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.

column4: `共济失调`（HP:0001251）的表现之一，表现为进行快速交替运动的功能受损，比如不能有节奏地用手拍打膝盖，一般为小脑病变所致。
column5: A type of `ataxia` (HP:0001251) characterized by the impairment of the ability to perform rapidly alternating movements, such as rhythmically tapping the fingers on the knee, generally related to a cerebellar lesion.

column4: 偏头痛是一种慢性神经系统疾病，特点是发作性头痛及相关症状。
column5: Migraine is a chronic neurological disorder characterized by episodic attacks of headache and associated symptoms.

column4: 偏头痛（HP:0002076）的一种类型，先兆的特点为局灶性神经现象，通常进行性的，可伴有或不伴有头痛。先兆的症状可以包括完全可逆的视觉，感觉，和言语症状，但没有运动无力。视觉症状可能包括闪光、点、线和/或视觉缺失，和/或单侧感觉症状诸如感觉异常或麻木。至少一个的先兆症状逐渐发展超过5分钟或更长时间，和/或不同的症状连续发生。
column5: A type of `migraine` (HP:0002076) in which there is an aura characterized by focal neurological phenomena that usually proceed, but may accompany or occur in the absence of, the headache. The symptoms of an aura may include fully reversible visual, sensory, and speech symptoms but not motor weakness. Visual symptoms may include flickering lights, spots and lines and/or loss of vision and/or unilateral sensory symptoms such as paresthesias or numbness. At least one of the symptoms of an aura develops gradually over 5 or more minutes and/or different symptoms occur in succession.

column4: 一种影响近端肌肉的共济失调（HP:0001251），尤其是那些参与步态稳定的肌肉。
column5: A kind of `ataxia` (HP:0001251) that affects the proximal musculature, especially that involved in gait stability.

column4: 胼胝体发育不完全。
column5: Underdevelopment of the corpus callosum.

column4: 摆动性小脑性共济失调，肢体静止或刚开始随意运动时消失，持续运动和需要更加精准时加重（例如，触摸目标如患者的鼻子或医生的手指） 。
column5: An oscillatory cerebellar ataxia that tends to be absent when the limbs are inactive and during the first part of voluntary movement but worsening as the movement continues and greater precision is required (e.g., in touching a target such as the patient's nose or a physician's finger).

column4: 反复的头痛发作持续4-72小时，符合至少下列两个的标准:1）单侧，2）搏动性，3）中度或重度疼痛，和4）日常体力活动可加重，避免日常活动避免如爬楼梯。头痛发作通常伴有恶心，呕吐，畏光，或畏声。
column5: Repeated headache attacks lasting 4-72 h fulfilling at least two of the following criteria: 1) unilateral location, 2) pulsating quality, 3) moderate or severe pain intensity, and 4) aggravation by or causing avoidance of routine physical activity such as climbing stairs. Headache attacks are commonly accompanied by nausea, vomiting, photophobia, or phonophobia.

column4: 一种神经管缺陷，其特征为脑的囊样突起，以及颅骨开口处覆盖脑的膜上的囊样突起。
column5: A neural tube defect characterized by sac-like protrusions of the brain and the membranes that cover it through openings in the skull.

column4: 一种发生在颅骨的枕骨区域的脑膨出（即，颅内容物包括脑组织从通常覆盖有皮肤或粘膜的头盖骨上的先天性开口突出去）。枕叶脑膨出表现为枕骨中线肿胀，通常有正常厚度的头皮覆盖。
column5: A type of encephalocele (that is, a a protrusion of part of the cranial contents including brain tissue through a congenital opening in the cranium, typically covered with skin or mucous membrane) in the occipital region of the skull. Occipital encephalocele presents as a midline swelling over the occipital bone. It is usually covered with normal full-thickness scalp.

column4: 呼吸系统（FMA:7158）的异常，包括呼吸道，肺部和呼吸肌。
column5: An abnormality of the `respiratory system` (FMA:7158), which include the airways, lungs, and the respiratory muscles.

column2: Abnormality of the upper respiratory tract
column4: `上呼吸道`（FMA:45661）的异常。
column5: An abnormality of the `upper respiratory tract` (FMA:45661).

column4: 肺部（FMA:7195）的异常。
column5: An abnormality of the `lung` (FMA:7195).

column4: 肺实质任何部分的炎症。
column5: Inflammation of any part of the lung parenchyma.

column4: 肺动脉高血压被定义为在休息平均肺动脉压大于25毫米汞柱（正常水平10毫米汞柱），或在锻炼期间大于30毫米汞柱（正常水平15毫米汞柱）。肺动脉压力通过右心脏导管检查来确定。
column5: Pulmonary hypertension is defined as a mean pulmonary artery pressure greater than 25 mm Hg during rest (normal level, 10 mm Hg) or greater than 30 mm Hg during exercise (normal level, 15 mm Hg), as determined with right heart catheterization.

column4: 不能为机体细胞提供充足的氧气和除去过量的二氧化碳。
column5: Failure to adequately provide oxygen to cells of the body and to remove excess carbon dioxide.

column4: 呼吸费力或劳力性呼吸困难。
column5: Difficult or labored breathing.

column4: 哮喘患者的气管支气管树因多种应激因素导致气道狭窄，引起呼吸困难、咳嗽、喘息等表现。
column5: Asthma is characterized by increased responsiveness of the tracheobronchial tree to multiple stimuli, leading to narrowing of the air passages with resultant dyspnea, cough, and wheezing.

column4: 由吸入性肺炎易感性增加导致。反复吸入性肺炎是由于吸入异物导致的肺炎，表现为吸入性肺炎反复性发作。
column5: Increased susceptibility to aspiration pneumonia, defined as pneumonia due to breathing in foreign material, as manifested by a medical history of repeated episodes of aspiration pneumonia.

column4: 肺叶形成时的缺陷。
column5: Defects in the formation of pulmonary lobules.

column4: 胸膜炎症。
column5: Inflammation of the pleura.

column4: 是胸膜的异常。胸膜(FMA:9734)是覆盖在肺与内侧胸壁的薄而透明的膜。
column5: An abnormality of the `pulmonary pleura` (FMA:9734), the thin, transparent membrane which covers the lungs and lines the inside of the chest walls.

column4: 呼吸肌无运动，肺中无气体交换。这个术语指呼吸暂停反复发作，而不是一个单一的事件。
column5: Lack of breathing with no movement of the respiratory muscles and no exchange of air in the lungs. This term refers to a disposition to have recurrent episodes of apnea rather than to a single event.

column4: 从喉、气管、支气管或肺部咳出血或血丝痰。
column5: Coughing up (expectoration) of blood or blood-streaked sputum from the larynx, trachea, bronchi, or lungs.

column4: 胸腔内气体积聚，导致肺部分或完全萎陷。
column5: Accumulation of air in the pleural cavity leading to a partially or completely collapsed lung.

column4: 胸部或肺无外伤时发生的气胸。
column5: Pneumothorax occurring without traumatic injury to the chest or lung.

column4: 支气管（FMA:70774）的结构异常。
column5: An abnormality of the `set of bronchi`(FMA:70774).

column4: 由于局部不可逆转的结构破坏和大气道的扩张，导致支气管的持续异常扩张。
column5: Persistent abnormal dilatation of the bronchi owing to localized and irreversible destruction and widening of the large airways.

column4: 在`脑室`的异常（FMA:275917）。
column5: Abnormality of the `cerebral ventricles` (FMA:275917).

column4: 脑的脑室系统容积增大。
column5: An increase in size of the ventricular system of the brain.

column4: 萎缩的大脑皮质。
column5: Atrophy of the cortex of the cerebrum.

column4: 复发性失神发作是种全面性癫痫发作（HP:0002197），其特点是意识丧失，因此，是一种`呆滞性癫痫发作`形式（HP:0011146）。
column5: Recurrent absence seizures are `generalized seizures` (HP:0002197) and are characterized by a loss of consciousness, thus, are a form of `dialeptic seizures` (HP:0011146).

column4: 癫痫发作，突然、短暂的（<100毫秒）的单块肌肉或肌群不自主地单次或多次不规则收缩（轴性，四肢近端，远端）。
column5: Seizures with sudden, brief (< 100 msec) involuntary single or multiple contraction(s) of muscles(s) or muscle groups of variable topography (axial, proximal limb, distal).

column4: 大脑半球的特征在于小脑回（卷积）数量过多的大脑的表面上的先天性异常。
column5: A congenital abnormality of the cerebral hemisphere characterized by an excessive number of small gyri (convolutions) on the surface of the brain.

column4: 周期性发作的不协调和不平衡。
column5: Periodic spells of incoordination and imbalance.

column4: 大脑中有充满脑脊液的囊性结构或空腔。
column5: A disorder of the brain in which a cyst or cavity filled with cerebrospinal fluid develops in the cerebral hemisphere.

column4: 发作持续时间超过30分钟或更长时间或多次癫痫频繁重复发作，发作之间未恢复知觉。
column5: Seizures lasting for more than 30 minutes or longer or multiple seizures repeated frequently without regaining consciousness between seizures.

column4: `基底节`的异常（FMA:84013）。
column5: Abnormality of the `basal ganglia` (FMA:84013).

column4: 出现在基底节区（FMA:84013）的钙沉积(MPATH:36)，可累及一个或多个基底节区核团。
column5: The presence of `calcium deposition` (MPATH:36) affecting one or more structures of the `basal ganglia` (FMA:84013).

column4: 是一种异常的步态模式，站立和行走时双脚距离很宽。这往往是小脑性共济失调的组成部分。
column5: An abnormal gait pattern in which persons stand and walk with their feet spaced widely apart. This is often a component of cerebellar ataxia.

column4: 发生在蛛网膜（FMA:9591）和软脑膜（FMA:9590）之间的出血（MPATH:119）。
column5: `Hemorrhage` (MPATH:119) occurring between the `arachnoid mater` (FMA:9591) and the `pia mater` (FMA:9590).

column4: 脑局部区域丧失血液循环，导致相应的神经系统功能缺陷。
在`脊髓`的异常（FMA:7647）。
column5: An abnormality of the `spinal cord` (FMA:7647) (myelon).

column4: 在正常的胚胎发育中，脊髓最初占据整个脊柱的长度，但随着脊髓圆锥和椎体的分化、生长，最终位于L1水平的位置。终丝是远侧胚胎脊髓退缩之后形成的一种细长的线状结构并将脊髓附着在尾骨上。如果有一根粗大的绳子样的终丝将脊髓固定在L2水平或以下就会导致脊髓栓系，并且可能会因为脊髓收到的异常张力而导致神经系统体征。
column5: During normal embryological development, the spinal cord first occupies the entire length of the vertebral column but goes on to assume a position at the level of L1 due to differential growth of the conus medullaris and the vertebral column. The filum terminale is a slender, threadlike structure that remains after the normal regression of the distal embryonic spinal cord and attaches the spinal cord to the coccyx. A tethered cord results if there is a thickened rope-like filum terminale which anchors the cord at the level of L2 or below, potentially causing neurologic signs owing to abnormal tension on the spinal cord.

column4: 额颞叶功能退变引起的痴呆类型，临床表现为个性和行为改变，如脱抑制行为，冷漠和自知力缺乏。
column5: A dementia associated with degeneration of the frontotemporal lobe and clinically associated with personality and behavioral changes such as disinhibition, apathy, and lack of insight.

column4: `血`（FMA:9670）中`磷酸盐 `（CHEBI：18367）的浓度异常降低 。
column5: An abnormally decreased `phosphate` (CHEBI:18367) concentration in the `blood` (FMA:9670).

column4: `血`（FMA：9670）中`尿酸`（27226 CHEBI）的水平异常增高。
column5: An abnormally high level of `uric acid` (CHEBI:27226) in the `blood` (FMA:9670).

column4: 血液`乳酸 `（CHEBI：24996)（2-羟基丙酸）的异常增加。乳酸是在正常代谢过程中由乳酸脱氢酶代谢产生的丙酮酸而来。
column5: Abnormally increased level of blood `lactate` (CHEBI:24996)  (2-hydroxypropanoic acid). Lactate is produced from pyruvate by lactate dehydrogenase during normal metabolism.

column4: `血 `（FMA：9670）中的`蛋白`（CHEBI：36080）的`浓度增加 `（0001162 PATO）。
column5: An `increased concentration` (PATO:0001162) of `proteins` (CHEBI:36080) in the `blood` (FMA:9670).

column4: 血液中`钾`（CHEBI：29103） 的浓度异常增加 。
column5: An abnormally increased `potassium` (CHEBI:29103) concentration in the blood.
An elevated concentration of `glycine` (CHEBI:15428) in the `blood` (FMA:9670).

column4: `血`（FMA：9670）中'甘油三酯 `（17855 CHEBI）水平的异常增加。
column5: An abnormal increase in the level of `triglycerides` (CHEBI:17855) in the `blood` (FMA:9670).
An increased concentration of `homocystine` (CHEBI:17485) in the `urine` (FMA:12274).

column4: `血液`（FMA：9670）中'氮化合物`(CHEBI:51143)的浓度增加。
column5: An increased concentration of `nitrogen compounds` (CHEBI:51143) in the `blood` (FMA:9670).

column3: 尿中硫酸乙酰肝素排泄
column5: An `increased concentration` (PATO:0001162) of `heparan sulfates` (CHEBI:35721) in the `urine` (FMA:12274).
An increased concentration of `homocystine` (CHEBI:17485) in the `blood` (FMA:9670).

column4: `血`（FMA：9670）中`赖氨酸`（25094 CHEBI）的浓度增加。
column5: An increased concentration of `lysine` (CHEBI:25094) in the `blood` (FMA:9670).

column4: 脖子上的头发延伸异常。
column5: Hair on the neck extends more inferiorly than usual.

column4: 甲的发育不良。
column5: The presence of `developmental dysplasia` (MPATH:64) of the `nail` (FMA:54326).

column2: Impaired vibration sensation in the lower limbs
column4: 腿感知振动的能力下降。
column5: A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration in the legs.

column4: 对一个突然施加并持续拉伸的外力做出的回应，出现一系列有节律、不自主的肌肉收缩（频率约为5-7赫兹）。
column5: A series of rhythmic and involuntary muscle contractions (at a frequency of about 5 to 7 Hz) that occur in response to an abruptly applied and sustained stretch.

column4: 发生在颅内（FMA:46565）的出血（MPATH:119）。
column5: `Hemorrhage` (MPATH:119) occurring within the `skull` (FMA:46565).

column4: 存在于'中枢神经系统`（FMA:55675）的`胶质细胞增生` (MPATH:182)。
column5: The presence of `gliosis` (MPATH:182) in the `central nervous system` (FMA:55675).

column4: 由于平衡系统、脊柱或下肢骨骼、肌肉异常，引起下肢行走不利，步态异常。
column5: As the balance system, spine or lower limb skeletal, muscle abnormalities, causing lower limb walking adverse and gait abnormalities.

column4: 由多种原因引起的血糖浓度过低所致。一般以血浆血糖浓度<2.8mmol/L，可引起交感神经兴奋症群，如激动不安、饥饿、软弱、出汗、心动过速、收缩压升高、舒张压降低、震颤，一过性黑蒙，意识障碍，甚至昏迷。
column5: Due to a variety of reasons caused by low blood sugar concentration, usually with plasma glucose concentration <2.8mmol / L, which can cause sympathetic excitability , such as agitation, hunger, weakness, sweating, tachycardia, systolic blood pressure, diastolic blood pressure, tremor, disturbance of consciousness, and even coma.

column4: 当固定肢体在一个位置时诱发的震颤。
column5: A type of tremors that is triggered by holding a limb in a fixed position.

column4: 脊髓受到外部机械压缩。
column5: External mechanical compression of the spinal cord.

Ankylosing spasticity of the back muscles that causes the head and lower limbs to bend back and the torso forward into an arcuate state,which can be found in a variety of causes of encephalitis, meningitis.

column4: 逐渐丢失的神经元细胞和神经组织。
column5: Progressive loss of neural cells and tissue.

column4: 大脑内液体异常蓄积。
column5: Abnormal accumulation of fluid in the brain.

column4: 对高分贝声音异常敏感。
column5: An abnormally heightened sensitivity to loud sounds.

column4: 称为tau蛋白的微管相关蛋白过度磷酸化之后形成病理性蛋白，聚合形成不溶性形式
column5: Pathological protein aggregates formed by hyperphosphorylation of a microtubule-associated protein known as tau, causing it to aggregate in an insoluble form.

column4: 在复杂运动指令的理解和在某些已学习动作的执行方面的缺陷，如在认知已学习运动的成分的缺陷。

column5: The passage of blackish, tarry feces associated with gastrointestinal hemorrhage. Melena occurs if the blood remains in the colon long enough for it to be broken down by colonic bacteria. One degradation product, hematin, imbues the stool with a blackish color. Thus, melena generally occurs with bleeding from the upper gastrointestinal tract (e.g., sotmach ulcers or duodenal ulcers), since the blood usually remains in the gut for a longer period of time than with lower gastrointestinal bleeding.

column4: 大肠的任何异常。

column4: 灰质异位是指因灰质团块位于脑内错误的位置导致的神经功能障碍，是皮质畸形的一种。除了位置，异位的神经元可能是正常的；且葡萄糖代谢水平与正常位置的灰质一致。这种情况可以造成的多种不同症状，但通常包含一定程度的癫痫或反复痫性发作，常会影响大脑更高水平的能力。其表现可以无症状，也可以引起严重症状，比如严重的癫痫，运动能力丧失，智力低下。
column5: Gray matter heterotopia is a neurological disorder caused by clumps of grey matter being located in the wrong part of the brain. It is characterized as a type of cortical malformation. The neurons in heterotopia may appear to be normal, except for their mislocation; nuclear studies have shown glucose metabolism equal to that of normally positioned gray matter. The condition causes a variety of symptoms, but usually includes some degree of epilepsy or recurring seizures, and often affects the brain's ability to function on higher levels. Symptoms range from nonexistent to profound, in which case heterotopia can result in severe seizure disorder, loss of motor skills, and mental retardation.

column4: 在发育早期就有正常语言获得方式的紊乱，表现为发音、语言理解，或语言表达能力发育的延迟和异常.

column4: 是一种睡眠异常包括以下现象:1）失眠/睡眠过度，2）非恢复性睡眠，3）睡眠节律紊乱，4）白天过度嗜睡，5）睡眠呼吸暂停，和6）躁动。

column5: Febrile seizures are convulsions induced by a fever in infants or small children and are generally characterized by loss of consciousness and tonic-clonic movements. Most febrile seizures last a minute or two.

column4: 异常的运动减少。与瘫痪相比，运动迟缓并不是缺乏运动的力量，而是运动的贫乏。典型的习惯性动作（如交叉双臂，盘腿）的频率减低。
column5: Abnormally diminished motor activity. In contrast to paralysis, hypokinesia is not characterized by a lack of motor strength, but rather by a poverty of movement. The typical habitual movements (e.g., folding the arms, crossing the legs) are reduced in frequency.

column4: 丧失发育能力，表现为缺少里程碑性的发育标志。

column3: 副神经节瘤相关的颅神经麻痹

column4: 指在皮肤下观察到的细微、局部及不自主地肌肉收缩（抽搐），是由于轴索的兴奋性增高导致的（通常是运动神经元病的表现）。这导致了轴索支配的所有肌肉纤维独立于其他运动单位的自发性放电。
column5: Fasciculations are observed as small, local, involuntary muscle contractions (twitching) visible under the skin. Fasciculations result from increased irritability of an axon (which in turn is often a manifestation of disease of a motor neuron). This leads to sporadic discharges of all the muscle fibers controlled by the axon in isolation from other motor units.

column3: 局灶性发作伴有意识障碍

column4: 双下肢力弱或部分瘫痪
column5: Weakness or partial paralysis in the lower limbs.

column4: 如果透明隔的两个薄层未融合在一起，那么就会出现的一个充满液体的空间或空腔。透明隔间腔在出生时存在，但通常3-6个月时消失。它宽约1cm，壁是平行的。它是一个封闭的空间，不属于脑室系统的一部分，不与蛛网膜下腔相连。
column5: If the two laminae of the septum pellucidum are not fused then a fluid-filled space or cavum is present. The cavum septum pellucidum is present at birth but usually obliterates by the age of 3 to 6 months. It is up to 1cm in width and the walls are parallel. It is an enclosed space and is not part of the ventricular system or connected with the subarachnoid space.

column4: 脊髓的动静脉连接异常。

column3: 脑电图，伴多棘慢复合波
column4: 脑电图示重复的棘波之后紧随慢波。
column5: The presence of complexes of repetitive spikes and waves in EEG.

column4: 病人站立时并脚来保持平衡，然后被要求闭上眼睛。如果闭眼后失去平衡曾考虑为闭目难立征阳性，可能存在本体感觉的异常。
column5: The patient stands with the feet placed together and balance and is asked to close his or her eyes. A loss of balance upon eye closure is a positive Romberg sign and is interpreted as indicating a deficit in proprioception.

column4: 小脑上脚（FMA:72495）的宽度增加。
column5: Increased width of the `superior cerebellar peduncle` (FMA:72495).

column4: 累及肢体的一种辨距不良（HP:0001310）。
column5: A type of `dysmetria` (HP:0001310) involving the limbs.

column4: 脑部的动静脉连接异常
脑导水管狭窄（也被称为脑导管，中脑导水管，或西尔维于导水管），导水管连接间脑的第三脑室到第四脑室，位于脑桥和小脑之间。
column5: Stenosis of the cerebral aqueduct (also known as the mesencephalic duct, aqueductus mesencephali, or aqueduct of Sylvius), which connects the third cerebral ventricle in the diencephalon to the fourth ventricle, which is between the pons and cerebellum.

column4: 慢性神经损伤相关的运动单位的连续，快速收缩。放电产生于再生神经的周边方面和临床上赋予身体表面覆盖在该肌肉的几乎连续的起伏
column5: Successive and rapid contractions of motor units associated with chronic nerve injury. The discharges arise from the peripheral aspects of regenerating nerves, and clinically impart a nearly continuous undulation of the body surface overlying the muscle.

column4: 胚胎神经管不完全闭合，因此一些椎弓仍然未融合和开放。在最轻的形式是隐性脊柱裂，其次为脑脊髓膜膨出和脑脊髓脊膜膨出。
column5: Incomplete closure of the embryonic neural tube, whereby some vertebral arches remain unfused and open. The mildest form is spina bifida occulta, followed by meningocele and meningomyelocele.

column4: 脑白质营养不良是指源于中枢神经系统髓鞘变性的脑白质退变。它们的基本缺陷与髓鞘膜的合成和维持直接相关。
column5: Leukodystrophy refers to deterioration of white matter of the brain resulting from degeneration of myelin sheaths in the CNS. Their basic defect is directly related to the synthesis and maintenance of myelin membranes.

column4: 中脑（61993 FMA）的形态异常，其组成部分包括中脑顶盖，大脑脚，中脑被盖和中脑导水管。
column5: An abnormality of the `midbrain` (FMA:61993), which has as its parts the tectum, cerebral peduncle, midbrain tegmentum and cerebral aqueduct.

column4: 在轴位磁共振成像的中脑异常表现，细长的小脑上脚使中脑呈现磨牙或智齿的外观。
column5: An abnormal appearance of the midbrain in axial magnetic resonance imaging in which the elongated superior cerebellar peduncles give the midbrain an appearance reminiscent of a molar or wisdom tooth.

column4: 站或坐时很难保持头的正确位置。
column5: Difficulty to maintain correct position of the head while standing or sitting.

column4: 在运动能力的缺陷导致的不能发音。
column5: A defect in the motor ability that enables speech.

column4: 语言表达能力障碍，和语言理解能力相对保留。也就是说，病人可以理解语言（语音，文字），但不能表达。
column5: Impairment of expressive language  and relative preservation of receptive language abilities. That is, the patient understands language (speech, writing) but cannot express it.

column4: 通过脊柱缺口脑膜膨出。
column5: Protrusion of the meninges through a defect of the vertebral column.

column4: 累及数学和计算的学习障碍。
column5: A specific learning disability involving mathematics and arithmetic.

column4: 下丘脑存在错构瘤（FMA:62008）。
column5: The presence of a `hamartoma` of the `hypothalamus` (FMA:62008).

column4: 相关的脊髓损伤水平以下的所有四肢、躯干的麻痹。四肢瘫的病因是类似于截瘫的不同之处在于病变是在颈脊髓而不是在脊髓的胸腰椎段。
column5: Paralysis of all four limbs, and trunk of the body below the level of an associated injury to the spinal cord. The etiology of quadriplegia is similar to that of paraplegia except that the lesion is in the cervical spinal cord rather than in the thoracic or lumbar segments of the spinal cord.

column4: 中枢神经系统病变区域的`星形胶质细胞`（CL:0000127）的增殖。
column5: Proliferation of `astrocytes` (CL:0000127) in the area of a lesion of the central nervous system.

column4: 影响肢体肌肉的一种肌张力障碍（异常肌张力增加导致固定的异常姿势）。
column5: A type of dystonia (abnormally increased muscular tone causing fixed abnormal postures) that affects muscles of the limbs.

column4: 在`苍白球`的异常（FMA:61835）。
column5: An abnormality of the `globus pallidus` (FMA:61835).

column2: Eye of the tiger anomaly of globus pallidus
column4: 双侧苍白球、黑质MRI T2加权像对称性低信号，且在`苍白球`(FMA:61835)低信号的前内侧出现斑点状高信号，外观类似老虎眼。
column5: The presence, on T2-weighted magnetic resonance imaging, of markedly low signal intensity if the `globus pallidus` (FMA:61835) that surrounds a central region of high signal intensity in the anteromedial globus pallidus, producing an eye-of-the-tiger appearance.

column4: `自主神经系统`（FMA:9905）`功能失调`（PATO:0001641）。
column5: `Dysfunction` (PATO:0001641) of the `autonomic nervous system` (FMA:9905).

column4: 四肢远端的肌肉强度降低。
column5: Reduced strength of the musculature of the distal extremities.

column2: Dense calcifications in the cerebellar dentate nucleus
column4: 小脑齿状核致密钙化
一种与双侧上运动神经元的锥体束和锥体外束损伤相关的构音障碍。受累的个体的语言缓慢、费力而且音质刺耳。
column5: A type of dysarthria related to bilateral damage of the upper motor neuron tracts of the pyramidal and extra- pyramidal tracts. Speech of affected individuals is slow, effortful, and has a harsh vocal quality.

column3: 非进行性小脑性共济失调

column4: `脑皮质`体积减小（FMA:61830）。
column5: Reduced size of the `cerebral cortex` (FMA:61830).

column4: 延迟获得使用语言进行表达需要、愿望或想法的能力
column5: A delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts.

column4: 通过脊柱缺损处膨出的脊膜和部分脊髓。
column5: Protrusion of the meninges and portions of the spinal cord through a defect of the vertebral column.

column3: 原始反射（掌颏反射，口鼻部，眉间）

column4: 肝功能衰竭相关的中枢神经系统功能障碍，临床特点（取决于严重程度）为嗜睡，意识模糊，眼球震颤，去皮层状态，痉挛，双侧巴宾斯基反射阳性。
column5: Central nervous system dysfunction in association with liver failure and characterized clinically (depending on degree of severity) by lethargy, confusion, nystagmus, decorticate posturing, spasticity, and bilateral Babinski reflexes.

column4: 在收缩或电刺激后发生的一种不自主的、疼痛延迟的骨骼肌松弛状态。
column5: An involuntary and painless delay in the relaxation of skeletal muscle following contraction or electrical stimulation.

column4: 运动多动与整个身体肌肉过度的运动。
column5: Motor hyperactivity with excessive movement of muscles of the body as a whole.

column4: 脑脊液中乳酸浓度升高。
column5: Increased concentration of lactate in the cerebrospinal fluid.

column4: 面部肌肉的不自主收缩。
column5: Involuntary twitching of the facial muscles.

column4: 皮质脊髓束的异常，其是锥体系统的主要组成部分，是大脑和脊髓之间唯一的直接连接。
column5: Abnormality of the corticospinal tract, which is the chief element of the pyramidal system (the principle motor tract) and is the only direct connection between the cerebrum and the spinal cord.

column4: 从大脑运动皮层传递神经冲动到脊髓束的功能缺损。皮质脊髓束介导不相关联的自主技能运动。
column5: A functional deficit of the tract that conveys nervous impulses from the motor cortex of the brain to the spinal cord. The corticospinal tract mediates discrete voluntary skilled movements.

column4: REM睡眠异常。 REM睡眠阶段的特点是脑电图模式去同步化，心率增快、血压升高，交感神经激活，除了眼睛和中耳肌肉之外的其它肌张力明显消失。其后跟随快速眼球运动阶段。
column5: Abnormality of REM sleep. Phases of REM sleep are characterized by desynchronized EEG patterns, increases in heart rate and blood pressure, sympathetic activation, and a profound loss of muscle tonus except for the eye and middle-ear muscles. There are then phases of rapid eye movements.

column4: 感知振动的能力下降。临床上，通常使用128Hz的音叉放置于骨性突起，如踝尖或掌指关节。音叉的振动缓慢衰减。振动觉缺失的程度可以通过检查者感知振动长于患者的时间粗略计算。
column5: A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration. Clinically, this is usually tested with a tuning fork which vibrates at 128 Hz and is applied to bony prominences such as the malleoli at the ankles or the metacarpal-phalangeal joints. There is a slow decay of vibration from the tuning fork. The degree of vibratory sense loss can be crudely estimated by counting the number of seconds that the examiner can perceive the vibration longer than the patient.

column2: Abnormality of the cerebral white matter
column4: 在`脑白质`的异常（FMA:241998）。
column5: An abnormality of the `cerebral white matter` (FMA:241998).

column2: Calcification of the small brain vessels
column4: 大脑内的小血管钙盐沉积。
column5: Deposition of calcium salts within small blood vessels of the brain.

column4: 大脑弥漫非局灶性萎缩。
column5: Diffuse unlocalised atrophy affecting the cerebrum.

column4: 一种前脑无裂畸形的，其左右侧额顶叶融合，半球间纵裂只出现在后头部。
column5: A type of holoprosencephaly in which the left and right frontal and parietal lobes are fused and the interhemispheric fissure is only present posteriorly.

column4: 大脑的茎样部分（脑干）的结构发育异常，包括中脑、脑桥和延髓，脑干连接大脑半球与颈部脊髓。
column5: A developmental structural anomaly of the stalk-like part of the brain that comprises the midbrain (aka mesencephalon), the pons (aka pons Varolii), and the medulla oblongata, and connects the cerebral hemispheres with the cervical spinal cord.

column4: 痉挛性瘫痪影响到四肢。
column5: Spastic paralysis affecting all four limbs.

column4: 一种脑部的退行性疾病，其特点是以隐袭性起病的痴呆。记忆、判断力、注意力和解决问题的能力受损，继之出现严重的失用和全面的认知能力损害。首发症状出现在60岁后，其病理学标记是严重的皮质萎缩和老年斑、神经元纤维缠结、神经毡细丝。
column5: A degenerative disease of the brain characterized by the insidious onset of dementia. Impairment of memory, judgment, attention span, and problem solving skills are followed by severe apraxia and a global loss of cognitive abilities. The condition primarily occurs after age 60, and is marked pathologically by severe cortical atrophy and the triad of senile plaques, neurofibrillary tangles, and neuropil threads.

column4: 脑实质中出现钙沉积(MPATH:36)。
column5: The presence of `calcium deposition` (MPATH:36) within brain structures.

column4: 在颅骨（头骨）、脑组织和脑脊髓液之间的压力增加。
column5: An increase of the pressure inside the cranium (skull) and thereby in the brain tissue and cerebrospinal fluid.

column2: Abnormality of the periventricular white matter

column4: 高度失律是发作间歇期异常的高波幅脑波和不规则的棘波背景活动。脑电图（EEG）显示持续的（清醒时），高波幅（> 200赫兹），广泛的多形慢波，伴无组织的背景活动和多灶棘波。
column5: Hypsarrhythmia is abnormal interictal high amplitude waves and a background of irregular spikes. There is continuous (during wakefulness), high-amplitude (>200 Hz), generalized polymorphic slowing with no organized background and multifocal spikes demonstrated by electroencephalography (EEG).

column4: 无法产生下肢肌腱反射
column5: Inability to elicit tendon reflexes in the lower limbs.

column4: 突发、短暂性的双侧肌张力下降，常因情绪诱发。
column5: A sudden and transient episode of bilateral loss of muscle tone, often triggered by emotions.

column4: 重复非词语音的能力受损。非词重复（NWR）用于测量语音短期记忆。
column5: Impaired ability to repeat non-word sounds. Nonword repetition (NWR) is a measure of short-term phonological memory.

column2: Neuronal loss in central nervous system
column3: 中枢神经系统神经元损失

column4: 一种影响中线肌肉的肌张力障碍，例如胸部、腹部和背部肌肉。
column5: A type of dystonia that affects the midline muscles, i.e., the chest, abdominal, and back muscles.

column4: 上肢和下肢非自主的屈曲或伸直。
column5: Involuntary flexion or extension of the arms and legs.

column4: 大脑皮质的脑回（如脊）的异常。
column5: An abnormality of the gyri (i.e., the ridges) of the cerebral cortex of the brain.

column4: 在`大脑皮层`的异常（FMA:61830）。
column5: An abnormality of the `cerebral cortex` (FMA:61830).

column4: 大脑皮层（FMA:61830）存在发育异常(MPATH:64)。
column5: The presence of `developmental dysplasia` (MPATH:64) of the `cerebral cortex` (FMA:61830).

column4: 不能移动。
column5: Incapability to ambulate.

column4: 小脑，脑桥核，下橄榄核的神经元变性。
column5: Neuronal degeneration in the cerebellum, pontine nuclei, and inferior olivary nucleus.

column4: 由于颈部伸肌持续性性或阵发性挛缩导致头部向后倾斜。
column5: A form of `torticollis` (HP:0000473) in which the head is drawn back, either due to a permanent contractures of neck extensor muscles, or to a spasmodic contracture.

column2: Patchy demyelination of subcortical white matter
column3: 皮层下白质片状脱髓鞘
column4: 中枢神经系统神经纤维髓鞘的片状缺失。
column5: Patchy loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system.

column2: Parkinsonism with favorable response to dopaminergic medication
column3: 对多巴胺能药物反应良好的帕金森

column4: 面部毛发的缺失。
column5: Absence of `facial hair`(FMA:54360).

column4: 毛发的异常发育不良。
column5: `Developmental dysplasia` (MPATH:64) of the `hair` (FMA:53667).

column4: 眉毛中部位置的高度增加，形成了新月、半圆或倒U形。
column5: Increased height of the central portion of the eyebrow, forming a crescent, semicircular, or inverted U shape.

column4: 阴毛的缺失。
column5: Absence of `pubic hair`(FMA:54319).

column4: 乳头（FMA:67771）不发育。
column5: Underdevelopment of the `nipple` (FMA:67771).

column4: 存在两个以上的乳头。
column5: Presence of more than two nipples.

column4: 乳头位置比正常位置低。
column5: Placement of the nipples at a lower than normal location.

column4: 心包慢性炎症引起心包增厚、纤维化，在心脏周围形成非正常的外壳。
column5: Presence of a thickened, fibrotic pericardium that forms a non-compliant shell around the heart, and resulting from chronic inflammation of the pericardium.

column2: Malformation of the heart and great vessels
column4: 先天性心脏或大血管（如主动脉，肺动脉和肺静脉，上、下腔静脉）畸形。
column5: Congenital malformation of the heart or great vessels (i.e., the large blood vesslesentering and leaving the heart: aorta, the pulmonary arteries and veins, and the superior and inferior vena cava).

column4: 通常发生于肠发育过程中的肠道旋转和固定的异常。这将引起肠扭转，导致肠道的阻塞和坏死。
column5: An abnormality of the intestinal rotation and fixation that normally occurs during the development of the gut. This can lead to volvulus, or twisting of the intestine that causes obstruction and necrosis.

column4: 粪便中脂肪含量高于正常。这是小肠脂肪吸收不良的结果，产生泡沫状、恶臭味的漂浮粪质。
column5: Greater than normal amounts of fat in the feces. This is a result of malabsorption of lipids in the small intestine and results in frothy foul-smelling fecal matter that floats.

column4: 一种食管动力的异常，其特征为食管下段括约肌在吞咽时无法松弛，以及下半食管的蠕动不足或缺乏。
column5: A disorder of esophageal motility characterized by the inability of the lower esophageal sphincter to relax during swallowing and by inadequate or lacking peristalsis in the lower half of the body of the esophagus.

column4: 阵发性、反复发作的呕吐。
column5: Paroxysmal, recurrent episodes of vomiting.

column4: 通常伴随粪便或在粪便中经由肛门而出的（红色的）鲜血。大多数直肠出血来自结肠、直肠或肛门。
column5: The passage of fresh (red) blood per anus, usually in or with stools. Most rectal bleeding comes from the colon, rectum, or anus.

column4: 一种间歇性形式的腹痛。
column5: An `intermittent` (PATO:0000690) form of `abdominal pain` (HP:0002027).

column4: 食管和气管之间的一种异常连接（瘘管）。
column5: An abnormal connection (fistula) between the esophagus and the trachea.

column4: 肠道的一种异常，其中部分肠管内陷（叠缩）进入另一部分肠管。
column5: An abnormality of the `intestine` (FMA:7199) in which part of the intestine invaginates (telescopes) into another part of the intestine.

column4: 胃部的异常。
column5: An abnormality of the `stomach` (FMA:7148).

column4: 胃肌层张力降低，无阻塞也会出现胃排空能力下降。
column5: `Decreased strength` (PATO:0001779) of the `Muscle layer of stomach` (FMA:14909), which leads to a decreased ability to empty the contents of the stomach despite the absence of obstruction.

column4: 肠道的异常收缩，如痉挛和肠麻痹，与内源性或外源性因素导致的肠道调节肌肉活性的能力丧失相关。
column5: Abnormal intestinal contractions, such as spasms and intestinal paralysis, related to the loss of the ability of the gut to coordinate muscular activity because of endogenous or exogenous causes.

column4: 小肠的一部分围绕其自身或肠系膜轴的异常旋转。
column5: Abnormal twisting of a portion of intestine around itself or around a stalk of mesentery tissue.

column4: 一种伴随胃粘膜萎缩的慢性胃炎。
column5: A form of `chronic gastritis` (HP:0005231) associated with `atrophic` (PATO:0001623) `gastric mucous membrane` (FMA:14907).

column4: 结肠炎是指结肠的一种炎症，通常用来描述大肠（结肠，盲肠和直肠）的炎症。结肠炎可以是急性的，自限性的或者慢性的，在广义上属于消化系统疾病。
column5: Colitis refers to an inflammation of the colon and is often used to describe an inflammation of the large intestine (colon, cecum and rectum). Colitides may be acute and self-limited or chronic, and broadly fit into the category of digestive diseases.

column4: 来自肠道的出血。
column5: Bleeding from the intestines.

column4: 腹膜的异常。
column5: An abnormality of the `peritoneum` (FMA:9584).

column4: `存在于腹膜的炎症。
column5: `Inflammation` (MPATH:212) of the `peritoneum` (FMA:9584).

column4: 胃内容物以很大力量喷射性呕吐出来。
column5: Vomiting that ejects the gastric contents with great force.

column4: 部分十二指肠的粘膜糜烂。
column5: An erosion of the mucous membrane of in a portion of the duodenum.

column4: 表现为异常强烈的食欲并伴有暴饮暴食的神经疾病。
column5: A neurological anomaly with gross overeating associated with an abnormally strong desire or need to eat.

column4: 胃溃疡，即，某个区域的胃粘膜的糜烂。
column5: An `ulcer` (MPATH:579), that is, an erosion of an area of the `gastric mucous membrane` (FMA:14907).

column4: 肠淋巴管的扩张（即，淋巴管的膨胀）。
column5: Angiectasia of lymph vessels (i.e., dilatation of lymphatic vessels) in the intestines.

column4: `胰腺的发育不良。
column5: `Hypoplasia` (MPATH:133) of the `pancreas` (FMA:7198).

column4: 肠的急性阻塞阻止了肠内容物的通过。
column5: Acute obstruction of the intestines preventing passage of the contents of the intestines.

column4: 脉管系统异常即体内封闭式循环管道系统（包括心血管系统和淋巴系统）发生的异常（FMA:69050）。
column5: An abnormality of the `vasculature` (FMA:69050), which includes cardiovascular system and lymphatic system.

column4: 中等速度（3-4 Hz）的前 - 后方向的头部震颤。
column5: A head tremor of moderate speed (3 to 4 Hz) in the anterior-posterior direction.

column4: 下肢肌腱反射强度减弱，伸展肌腱并轻拍可以引起反射
column5: Reduced intensity of muscle tendon reflexes in the lower limbs. Reflexes are elicited by stretching the tendon of a muscle, e.g., by tapping.

column2: Paresis of extensor muscles of the big toe

column4: 累及胃肠道的毛细血管扩张。

column5: An overriding aorta is a congenital heart defect where the aorta is positioned directly over a ventricular septal defect, instead of over the left ventricle. The result is that the aorta receives some blood from the right ventricle, which reduces the amount of oxygen in the blood. It is one of the four conditions of the Tetralogy of Fallot. The aortic root can be displaced toward the front (anteriorly) or directly above the septal defect, but it is always abnormally located to the right of the root of the pulmonary artery. The degree of override is quite variable, with 5-95% of the valve being connected to the right ventricle.

column4: 由于免疫缺陷引起骨头感染，几乎总是由细菌引起。随着时间的推移，可能导致骨头本身的破坏。

column4: 当骨破坏发生在继发于另一种疾病过程（如肿瘤，感染和某些遗传骨疾患）而被削弱的区域时，发生病理性骨折。病理性骨折可在不引起健康骨骼骨折的创伤程度下出现。
column5: A pathologic fracture occurs when a bone breaks in an area that is weakened secondary to another disease process such as tumor, infection, and certain inherited bone disorders. A pathologic fracture can occur without a degree of trauma required to cause fracture in healthy bone.

column4: 骨折的反复发生（提示骨折趋势异常增加）。
column5: The repeated occurence of bone fractures (implying an abnormally increased tendency for fracture).

column4: 也被称为骨关节病、退行性关节病，是一种由于软骨逐渐丢失导致的渐进性关节疾病，该病导致关节边缘处骨刺及囊肿的产生。
column5: Also known as osteoarthrosis or degenerative joint disease (DJD), is a progressive disorder of the joints caused by gradual loss of cartilage and resulting in the development of bony spurs and cysts at the margins of the joints.

column4: 关节过度活动（关节运动能力超越正常范围），累及多个或全身关节。
column5: Joint hypermobility (ability of a joint to move beyond its normal range of motion) affecting many or all joints of the body.

column4: 存在一个以上的外生骨疣。一个外生骨疣是从骨表面上的良性生长的向外突出。它由软骨包绕，产生于源自软骨的骨。
column5: Presence of more than one exostosis. An exostosis is a benign growth the projects outward from the bone surface. It is cappped by cartilage, and arises from a bone that develops from cartilage.

column4: 软骨组织的形态结构异常。
column5: Any abnormality structure of cartilage tissue.

column4: 软骨点状钙化

column5: Increased resistance to the passage of air in the upper airway.

column4: 下呼吸道感染的易感性增加，表现为下呼吸道的反复感染。

column4: 气管和支气管软骨疾病，致使气道变软，患者难以保持气道通畅。

column5: An increased susceptibility to upper respiratory tract infections as manifested by a history of recurrent upper respiratory tract infections (running ears - otitis, sinusitis, pharyngitis, tonsillitis).

column5: Osteolysis refers to the destruction of bone through bone resorption with removal or loss of calcium.

column4: 出生时有一种或多种屈曲挛缩（关节弯曲，不能主动或被动伸直）。
column5: One or more flexion contractures (a bent joint that cannot be straightened actively or passively) that are present at birth.

column5: Hyperventilation refers to an increased pulmonary ventilation rate that is faster than necessary for the exchange of gases. Hyperventilation can result from increased frequency of breathing, an increased tidal volume, or both, and leads to an excess intake of oxygen and the blowing off of carbon dioxide.

column4: 糖基化转铁蛋白的浓度可作为N联糖基化保真度的标记物在血清中检测。在先天性糖基化缺陷病的传统命名法中，整个聚糖的缺失被命名为I型，一个或多个单糖的缺失被命名为II型。这些术语因历史原因被保留，但应记录新的注释作为对糖基化缺陷的精确注解。
column5: Glycosylated transferrin concentrations can be measured in serum as a marker of N-linked glycosylation fidelity. In the traditional nomenclature for congenital disorders of glycosylation, absence of entire glycans was designated type I, and loss of one or more monosaccharides as type II. These terms are retained for historical reasons but for new annotations the precise glycosylation defect should be recorded.

column5: An abnormal appearance of muscle fibers observed on muscle biopsy. Ragged red fibers can be visualized with Gomori trichrome staining as irregular and intensely red subsarcolemmal zones, whereas the normal myofibrils are green. The margins of affect fibers appear red and ragged. The ragged-red  is due to the accumulation of abnormal mitochondria below the plasma membrane of the muscle fiber, leading to the appearance of a red rim and speckled sarcoplasm.
